loans.name: Enyel Bradimir

texts.es:
El joven Enyel de 23 años de edad, es casado tiene un hijo y vive con su esposa en su casa ubicada en la cuidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose durante 4 años al comercio de calzado y sandalias para damas y caballeros.
Enyel esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para compra de zapato y sandalias para damas, caballeros y niños. Con el apoyo del préstamo el desea surtir mas su negocio y vender mas para ahorrar y comprarse un carro que el necesita para transportar su negocio ya que desea vender por mayor y vender en otras zonas cercanas para ir expandiendo su negocio.
Enyel su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorar  su negocio y su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
This young man, Enyel, is 23 years old. He is married and has one son. He and his wife live in their own house in the city of Nacaome, in southern Honduras. For the last four years, he has been in the business of selling shoes and sandals for men and women.

Enyel is requesting 20,000 lempiras to buy shoes and sandals for women, men, and children. With the support of this loan, he hopes to better stock his business and to make more sales so that he can save up and buy a car. He needs a car for his business, as he would like to sell wholesale and to sell in other nearby zones, in order to expand his business.

Enyel's dream is to continue working and to improve his business and his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals for his business

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, esta solicitando un nuevo prestamo, porque necesita invertir en el negocio, comprandose maiz tomates, repollos, salsa, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para elaborar la venta de pasteles, yuca, entre otros productos que se venden a diario en su negocio.
Con el prestamo anterior logro realizar una buena inversion, la cual el ha servido para mantenerse en el negocio, esta muy agradecida para seguir siendo cliente y mejorar a traves de los fondos con su familia.
texts.en: Blanca is requesting a new loan, because she needs to invest in her business,  She will buy corn, tomatoes, cabbage, sauces and other products that she needs to make and sell pastries, cassava and other products that she sells daily in her business.  With her previous loan, she managed to make a good investment which served to maintain her business.  She is very grateful to be able to continue as a client and improve her family's situation through these loans.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, cabbage and sauces

loans.name: Échelle Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ÉCHELLE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mickmanth Modjissola est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mickmanth Modjissola est âgée de 30 ans et est célibataire. Mickmanth Modjissola a un enfant scolarisé, et à sa charge. Mickmanth Modjissola a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Mickmanth Modjissola vit seule avec son enfant. Mickmanth Modjissola assure seule ses divers besoins. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Mickmanth Modjissola mène comme activité la vente des tissus par le système de distribution. Mickmanth exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans. Mickmanth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mickmanth Modjissola sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ÉCHELLE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The ÉCHELLE group is made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its activity.

The group's representative, Mickmanth Modjissola, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 30 years old and single.  She has one child who is her dependent and who goes to school.

Mickmanth Modjissola stopped studying at the university level.  She now lives alone with her child and takes care of her own needs by herself.  In order to cover her various expenses, she sells fabrics, through the distribution system.  She has been involved in this activity for the past four years, buying her supplies from a market in Benin and in Togo.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the  ÉCHELLE group.  This loan will be used to raise her inventory and to increase the group's customer base.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Rose  Jerotich

texts.en:
Rose still runs the grocery shop she opened six years ago. She now earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Rose is applying to borrow 70,000 KES, her seventh loan with KADET. With it she will buy more bags of maize and beans to sell. Her profits will help her to educate her children further--her dream in life.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Chantrea's Group

texts.en:
Chantrea, 28, is married and the mother of two dependent sons. She is a rice farmer and is also paid to sew palm leaves together by another business. Her husband catches fish to supplement the family’s income as well. Chantrea has been farming for nine years now and earns about 10,000 KHR a day.

Chantrea received her first loan from VisionFund three cycles ago. She used the past loans’ profits to better feed her family.

Now Chantrea is the leader of this group of two that is seeking a 800,000 KHR loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her fields and rice seedlings to transplant. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a higher rice yield and so make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wholesale cooking products like chicken, duck, vegetables and meat to cook traditional dishes.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprarse más mercadería para el negocio, ya que la demanda continua aumentando, se comprara aceite, arroz, azúcar, tomates, papas, embutidos entre otros más productos que son de utilidad,  este préstamo esta mejorando la reinversión al negocio de Sonia.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio los fondos necesarios para invertir en la compra de mercadería, para ofrecer a los clientes mayor variedad, gracias al crédito financiado por Kiva ella ha logrado mantener sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to ask for a new loan to buy more merchandise for her business because the demand keeps going up. She will buy oil, rice, sugar, tomatoes, potatoes, sausages and other useful products. This loan is improving her reinvestment in her business. 

She says that her previous loan gave her the funds she needed to buy merchandise to offer her customers more variety. Thanks to the Kiva loan she has been able to maintain her profits.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, tomatoes, potatoes and sausages.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es: Anselmo es un productor de café orgánico desde hace muchos años. El aprendió todo lo que sabe gracias a su padre quien también se dedicaba a esta actividad. Nos cuenta que de pequeño cuando era época de cosecha se iba a las fincas cuando salía de la escuela a cortar café pues de esta manera ayudaba a su familia. Cuando Anselmo se casó con Catalina se independizó ya que su padre le regaló un terreno para que trabajara por su cuenta. Ellos tienen una hija de 20 años y un hijo de 12 años. Cuando es época de corte su hijo le ayuda pues quiere enseñarlo para que cuando sea mayor se pueda dedicar a esta actividad si así lo decide. Su hija no está tan involucrada con la producción del café pues trabaja para una compañía de telefonía celular. El café que Anselmo produce es orgánico y para la siguiente cosecha necesita resembrar parte de su finca ya que las plantas que tiene ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida y por eso necesita un crédito. Si logra resembrar todo lo que tiene planeado en 3 años podrá aumentar su producción de 8 a 12 toneladas. Anselmo nos contó que para cuando termine la cosecha tiene planeado abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que de esta manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Anselmo is an organic coffee producer and has been for many years.  He learned everything from his father who also worked in the same activity.  He told us that when he was young he used to go to the ranch during harvest season to help his family harvest after school.  When Anselmo married Catalina he became financially independent because his dad gave him a piece of land to start off on his own.  They have a 20-year-old daughter and a 12-year-old son.  When it's harvest season his son helps because he wants to teach him the activity so that when he becomes an adult he can work on it if he so desires.  His daughter is not involved in the production of coffee because she works for a cell phone company.  Anselmo's coffee is organic and for the next season he needs to plant part of his ranch because the plants currently on it have reached their life cycle   and this is why he needs a loan.  If he achieves planting what he has planned, he will increase his production from 8 to 12 tonnes in 3 years.  Anselmo told us that when harvest is over he plans to open a grocery store in his house to increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants for his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine so that he can take on customer orders that he can't fill right now because he lacks the necessary equipment.

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.es: Leopolda y su esposo Guadalupe son productores de café orgánico desde hace más de 30 años. Junto con su hijo la esposa de este trabajan en sus fincas de café ya que de esta manera todo el ingreso se queda en la familia. Durante la última cosecha a Leopolda y su familia no les fue muy bien ya que el clima no se prestó para que tuvieran una buena producción y solo lograron 3 toneladas de café. Ella necesita comprar nueva planta y sembrar para que en los próximos años esta situación mejore y por esa razón está solicitando un crédito. Leopolda nos comentó que hace algunos años terminó de estudiar su educación básica pues sabe que nunca es tarde para superarse y ella aplica esta filosofía a cada aspecto de su vida. Aparte del café Leopolda y su familia tienen como meta poner un negocio de cría de cerdos para así mejorar sus ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leopolda and her husband Guadalupe have been are organic coffee producers for more than 30 years.  Together with their their son and his wife they work at their coffee plantation, this way all the income stays in the family.  Last harvest season wasn't very good for Leopolda and her family because the weather didn't cooperate and they were only able to harvest 3 tonnes of coffee.  She needs to buy new plants so that in the following years her situation improves and that's why she requests a loan.  Leopolda mentions that a few years ago she finished studying her basic education and knows it's never too late to get ahead and she applies this philosophy to every aspect of her life.  In addition to coffee, Leopolda and her family have the goal to start a pork producing business and increase their income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Sreydalin's Group

texts.en:
Sreydalin lives in a rural area of Thmor Koul district in Battambang Province. She is 29 years old, married and has two daughters in school. She has been raising pigs for the last three years, but a lack of money has hampered her in this venture.

With another woman in the village, Sreydalin has formed a group that is applying for a 1,800,000 KHR loan with VisionFund. This will be her second loan; the profits that arose from the first helped buy food for the family and pay school fees.

Sreydalin is going to use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She hopes it will help her raise fat and healthy pigs which she can sell for a better price. More income will improve the family’s standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Lorm's Group

texts.en:
Lorm is 45 years old and living in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district in Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. She has farmed rice to support her family for 17 years, and she also works to supplement her income as a vegetable seller as well as sometimes working for others for a fee. She earns about 30,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from the current business and manages to save about KHR10,000 each day after deducting daily expenses.
 
This is Lorm’s fourth loan with VisionFund. The past loans have relieved her family’s financial burden. She is now leading her group of three members, who are all females, to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and more various kinds of vegetables for selling. For expanding her field business, Lorm wants to buy two more hectares of farmland in order to generate income for her family. She hopes this loan will help her business become more profitable and also hopes to earn a larger income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
Santos Mauricio vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua. Tiene su negocio en un mercado de la capital  con una experiencia de 15 años. El   vende ropa de damas, caballeros, cazados, uniformes.

Santos esta solicitando este  crédito para  invertirlo en uniformes escolares, cazados, camisetas blancas, camisolines para niñas. ya que en esta época hay mucha demanda  por la celebración de las fiestas patrias  en estas actividades los padres de familia acuden a los centros de compra a adquirir sus uniformes  escolares para el desfile que se realiza en 14 de septiembre.

 Santos manifiesta que gracias a los créditos obtenidos por CEPRODEL  ha podido crecer en su negocio y  mejorar su casa para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Agradece a  CEPRODEL y KIVA  ya que con sus financiamientos han ayudado a muchas personas a crecer en su negocio
texts.en:
Santos Mauricio lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He has his business in the capital's market, and has 15 years experience. He sells women's and men's clothing, shoes and uniforms. 

Santos is requesting this loan in order to invest it in school uniforms, shoes, white T-shirts and girls' nightgowns.  At this time of year, there is a lot of demand because of the celebration of the national holidays. In these activities, parents flock to retail outlets to buy their school uniforms for the parade that takes place on September 14th.

Santos says that thanks to the loans obtained through Ceprodel, he has been able to make his business grow and improve his home, so that he can offer a better quality of life to his family.

He is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva, as with their loans, they have helped many people achieve growth in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and shoes.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual es un agricultor que se dedica a producir caña y café. Desde hace más de 22 años el se ha dedicado a esta actividad, aunque en sus inicios se dedicaba a trabajar para otras personas sin embargo con el paso del tiempo fue ahorrando dinero para poder comprar sus terrenos y además su padre le heredo una parcela. El café que Pascual produce es orgánico ya que no utiliza productos químicos en sus tierras y cuenta con una certificación que lo avala como productor de este tipo de café. Durante la última cosecha Pascual logró una producción total de 6 toneladas las cuales entregó a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. Para la siguiente cosecha Pascual necesita fertilizar y sembrar nueva planta pues algunas de las que tiene ya cumplieron con su ciclo de vida productivo. Para llevar a cabo estas actividades el necesita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Realizando estas tareas dentro de 3 años la producción de Pascual podría aumentar a 9 toneladas y por eso está muy entusiasmado. Pascual está casado con Alejandra con quien tiene dos hijos y a ellos les gustaría poderles brindar la oportunidad de que estudien una carrera universitaria para estar mejor preparados para el futuro.
texts.en:
Pascual is a farmer who has been producing sugar cane and coffee for more than 22 years. At the beginning he worked for other people, but over time he saved money to buy his own land and also inherited a parcel from his father. Pascual produces organic coffee and no longer uses chemical products on his land. He has been certified to produce this type of coffee. During his last harvest, Pascual produced 6 tons of coffee that he gave to the "Union Regional de Huatusco" to be processed and exported. 

For his next harvest, Pascual needs fertilizer and new plants because some have finished their productive cycle. In order to make this happen he needs a loan that he will pay back after the harvest. Doing this work over the next 3 years of production, Pascual will be able to increase his output to 9 tons which is very exciting for him. 

Pascual is married to Alejandra and they have 2 children, whom he would like to be able to give the opportunity to study at university so they are better prepared for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family. 

Abbas owns a shop for making birdcages. He learned this profession in his childhood with the help of his friends, and in 2007, he established his own business. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine for making birdcages.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and married. He supports a family of four children. He is a wheat farmer as well as runs a transport business. Peter has been in this business for the last eight years. He earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

He is servicing his third loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs. He will also be able to service his van and motorbikes.


He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve the families living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to service his van and motorcycles and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is an 18-year-old single male from Bani Kenanah - Irbed in Jordan. He requested a 400 JOD youth loan for his business retailing mobile cards and accessories. In the future, he would like to expand his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for mobile cards and accessories in his retail business.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is 61 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are employed.
Houssein owns a shop for construction supplies. He learned this business from his dad and in 1990 he established his own business. He has now two employees and a good reputation in his local community.
He is requesting a $2000 loan to expand the shop and install new shelves. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his shop and install new shelves.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 years, Sokly is married and has three children, all of whom are dependent on her. Two are in school and one is still under school-aged. Her family lives in a rural village of the Kror Kor district’s Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been farming rice on three hectares for nine years and raising pigs to supplement the income. She can earn approximately KHR 18,000 per day to meet the family’s needs and intends to save about KHR 8,000 each day after daily expenses. Lack of water supply is the main challenge for her business.

Sokly has been with VisionFund for three cycles and absolutely repaid the past loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the past loan to relieve her family’s burden and support her children's education. Now she and her group member are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for the paddy rice. She hopes to grow her crop yield in order to enlarge her income so as to improve her living lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the paddy rice

loans.name: Hoert's Group

texts.en: Hoert, a 53-year-old mother of eight children, is a resident of Moung Kul Borey District of Bateay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She overcame her family's hardships through raising chickens and cows. After 25 years, this business earns her about 19,000 KHR per day. For her, insufficient working capital to support her business is a big challenge. Her group consists of Hoert as the leader and another member. Hoert has never been with VisionFund before and neither has her co-member. Now, she is seeking 300,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 200,000 KHR. Hoert will use her loan portion to buy chicken feed. She hopes to raise healthy chickens and make more income.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy  is  29 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a charcoal dealer in Mwiki where he supplies charcoal to retailers. He has been in this business for the last eight years and gets an income of KES 70,000 per month.

He has a good credit history in KADET LTD. He is applying for his third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD with which he plans to buy more charcoal to sell.

He will use the anticipated profit to support his family and also for those who need his help. He hopes to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo ha trabajado en el campo durante toda su vida, desde que era un niño su padre lo llevaba a las fincas de café para que lo ayudara a cortar y conforme fue pasando el tiempo aprendió todo lo relacionado con la producción del café. El café que Pablo produce es orgánico ya que no utiliza fertilizantes que contengas productos químicos y durante la última cosecha logro llegar a la meta que se había propuesto: producir 10 toneladas. Para la siguiente cosecha Pablo necesita sembrar nueva planta de café pues algunas de las que tiene ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida y para esta solicita de un crédito. Con la renovación de sus fincas en un lapso de tres años Pablo estará cosechando aproximadamente 15 toneladas lo cual hará que pueda tener mejores ingresos. Además de producir café también tiene sembrada caña en una parte de sus terrenos. Pablo vive con su padre pues está soltero y pasando la cosecha le gustaría pintar su casa pues está un poco deteriorada por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en: Pablo has worked the land for his whole life. Since he was a young boy, his father would take him to the coffee fields so that he could help out, and over time, he learned everything to do with coffee production. The coffee that Pablo produces is organic, as he does not use fertilizers that contain chemical products. During the last harvest, he achieved the goal he had set out for himself: to produce 10 tons. For the following harvest, Pablo needs to plant new coffee plants because some of his have completed their life cycle. He is requesting a loan for this. With this renewal of his coffee fields, Pablo will be harvesting approximately 15 tons three years from now, improving his earnings. Besides producing coffee, he also has sugar cane planted on part of his land. Pablo lives with his father because he is single. After the harvest, he would like to paint his house because it's deteriorated a little and also just to pass the time.

loans.use: to renew his coffee fields

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en: Nem, 32, is a local resident of Kampong Cham Province's Dambae District. There are five members in her family, including three sons who are still in school. To support the family's basic needs, she has managed one hectare of cassava-growing farmland for 10 years, earning almost 17,000 KHR.  Nem is new to VisionFund but the other group member is a fourth-cycle loan client. Nem and her co-member are applying for 500,000 KHR and 100,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy insecticide and to pay the labor fee to transplant her rice and seed her farmland. She hopes to increase her income through her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and to pay farming fees.

loans.name: Naeim

texts.en:
Naeim is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Naeim owns a shop for making aluminum doors and cabinets. He learned this profession during his childhood and in 1993, he established his own business. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a machine specialized for his work and to buy raw materials. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and a machine specialized for his work

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en: Pacifique is 24 years old. She is married and has a one-year-old child. She sells clothes and has been selling for six years. With the loan, she wants to add more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used for renovating her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Ms. Nazeeran is 21 years old and married. She is an enthusiastic lady who has been making wooden baskets at home for many years. She sells them door to door and in fruits markets. She makes a wide range of baskets from different materials. She is very popular in her community.Her husband is a government employee and unable to support his family alone. Nazeeran's contribution to the family income is enough to support her family well.

She is a mother of three children. She lives in a large conventional family with her husband, children and other relatives. She needs to have an increase in her earnings to carry out the everyday expenditures of her family.  To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000/-. She will be using the loan to buy different types of wood to offer a variety of baskets to her customers. She wishes to use part of the profits on building a separate room for her children. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy different types of wood to offer diverse variety of baskets.

loans.name: Sokhei's Group

texts.en:
As one of the breadwinners in the family, Sokhei is a farmer growing cassava and cashews in order to support her three children. Two of her children are students and one is helping the family's business. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. For this business, the dropping price in the market is the key challenge for her as it affects her income. 

Sokhei has been with Kiva's partner VisionFund for five loans. After each loan has been repaid, she feels empowered to upgrade her living conditions better than before. Now, she forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. The other member is a first-time borrower and seeks a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader requesting a loan of 400,000 KHR, Sokhei will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for weeding for her cassava field. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to buy rubber plant seedlings for resale for additional income. She hopes to make more income from her business so as she can maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, tea leaves and cereals in wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To rent banana fields for two years, the harvests from which are used to make banana wine for sale in her bar.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es:
Alma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, se comprara gaseosas, jugos, agua, bebidas, gatorade, entre otros productos que le permiten ofrecer a los clientes lo necesario para el consumo, ella siempre se mantiene con el negocio en el mercado, ofreciendo bebidas y sale de forma ambulante ofreciendo tostadas de platano, yuca y cualquier otro comestible.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y obtener mejores productos en variedad, su situación familiar ha mejorado, ella se mantiene trabajando y velando por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Alma is asking for a new loan because she needs to invest in her business. She will buy soft drinks, juices, water, Gatorade and other drinks as well as other products taht will allow her to offer her customers what they need. She always maintains the business in the market, offering drinks. She also goes out and offers toasted plantains, yucca and other foods as a street vendor. 

The effect that the previous loan had was to increase her income and obtain a variety of better products. Her family situation has improved and she has kept working and maintaining her wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, water, Gatorade and other drinks.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is 39 years old and provides for four members in her family with the earnings from her business, a small beauty salon, that she has established in her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy new tools that are necessary to expand her business, in hopes that she can open an independent beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta tiene 39 años, está casada con Celedonio, de 49 años, tienen siete hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron gracias a mucho esfuerzo en el trabajo.
Su actividad es la agricultura, cuenta con su propia parcela con plantas de cacao, hoja de coca y café. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 17 años, junto a su esposo, pero  en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros, para que logren extraer de manera más rápida los frutos. Ella siempre está en constante supervisión de sus plantas para que las plagas no las dañen. Posteriormente, lleva a comercializar su producto a los centros de acopio de su localidad, donde le pagan muy buenos precios. 

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y se siente orgullosa de saber que una vez más cuenta con este apoyo, pues así seguirá con su trabajo. Asimismo, se siente contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque los socios son personas que cumplen con sus responsabilidades.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono y fungicidas para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 39 years old. She is married to Celedonio, who is 49. They have seven children. They own the house they live in, which they bought thanks to their hard work. 

Her activity is farming. She has her own parcel of land with cacao plants, coca leaves and coffee. She has done this work for 17 years with her husband. During the harvest time, they have help from their children and from laborers to harvest the product as fast as possible. She is constantly supervising the plants so that pests don't damage them. Later, she takes the products to sell in the warehousing center of her community, where they give her a very good price.

This is her 14th loan with MFP and she feels proud to know she has this support once again, because this way she can continue with her work. In addition, she is happy to work with her communal bank, because the members are people who take care of their responsibilities.

With these 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy fertilizer and fungicide for her plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide for her plants.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old. He is married to Margaret and together they have five children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is his eighth loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase another dairy cow so as to add to his milk production.

He hopes to expand his business to have more income to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is a married woman who earns a living selling clothes from her home, an activity she has done for the last four years. She sells a variety of clothes ranging from women's to children's clothes. Zuhura speaks well of her job because it has given her good results. She also owns a rental house which earns her good income every month. She intends to offer more varieties to choose; so she is requesting a loan to add to her stock of clothes for sale. Zuhura faces the challenge of credit defaulters since she offers her merchandise on credit.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a young woman living in the city of Mombasa, which is a city noted for its hot climate. She is very hardworking. She works operating a food stall and with the fruits of her labor is able to help with household expenses. She works about 10 hours per day and believes she does well because she’s very responsible and above all because she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Mwanalima is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, etc. In this way she will be able to continue to offer good service to her customers. Her dream is to see her five children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 43 años, está casado con Laurenza, de 41 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron gracias a su trabajo y esmero.
Su trabajo es labrar la tierra en su parcela, tiene plantas de cacao, hojas de coca y café. Viene trabajando 19 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros para realizar la faena de recojo de los frutos. Sus productos más rentables son el cacao y las hojas de coca, las empresas acopiadoras le ofrecen mejores precios por entregar esos productos. Sin embargo, el problema que tiene que combatir es a los insectos que dañan las plantas. De todas maneras, sigue con su trabajo y juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras e incrementar su producción.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan, pues es un socio muy participativo.
Con los 500 nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 43 years old. He is married to Laurenza, who is 41 and with whom he has five children. They own the house they live in, which they bought thanks to their work and effort.  

His job is working his parcel of land. He has cacao, coca leaf and coffee plants. He has been working for 19 years and at harvest time has the help of laborers to harvest the product. His most profitable products are the cacao and the coca leaves. The wholesale businesses offer him better prices for these products. Nonetheless, the problem he has is fighting the insects that damage the plants. In any case, he keeps on working and getting the money together to buy new land and increase his production. 

This is his third loan with MFP. He knows he is responsible enough to make his payments on time and he is willing to do it. In his communal bank he is always up on all of the agreement they come to because he is a person who participates a lot.

With the 500 nuevos soles he has asked for, he will buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single young man. He is a worker in a fuel station and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his cost of living. He wants to start his own project, which is a store for selling mobile phones, so he is requesting a 2,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a collection of mobile phones to start selling to customers. Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to have his own business and ensure a better future for him and improve his living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture in his store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living from her rental houses.  She has managed to grow her business through her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  

She wants to start poultry farming.  For this reason, Caroline has requested 20,000 KES to buy chickens and set up a poultry house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and set up a poultry house.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha has shown a great desire to move forward. She obtained a Kiva loan which she was able to successfully repay. She is therefore requesting a new loan, this being her third loan from Yehu, to expand her existing business. She says that the previous loan enabled her to purchase more fruits and vegetables. With this requested loan, she intends to buy potatoes, tomatoes, and green beans. Mwanasha plans to open a retail shop soon.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, and green beans.

loans.name: Refaa

texts.en: Refaa is a 48-year-old married woman. She has a small business at home to help in supporting the family to improve their living conditions. Refaa is selling housewares to be able to do that. Now she has applied for this loan to increase her inventory size and bring in more goods.

loans.use: to increase her inventory size and bring in more goods.

loans.name: Rendempter

texts.en:
Rendempter is 41 years old and married to Samuel, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling avocados for the past two years with the monthly income of aboout KES10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rendempter will use the loan to buy more stock of avocados to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to the highest level of education and improve the living standards of the family

loans.use: to buy more stock of avocados to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is one of the active women in the neighborhood. She is a housewife who chose to start an embroidery business at home to support her husband, who works on a transportation bus line. She makes embroidered dresses and table covers to sell. She also takes special orders from customers if they want. She applied for this loan to buy more material to increase her productivity so that she can make a contract with one of the distributors to distribute her dresses in the market in the capital city of Amman.

loans.use: to buy more material to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a widowed mother and has adult children. She lives in her own home with her family. Despite her advanced age, she has been engaged in operating her business selling cashew nuts. She sells at the market. Mwanaisha is a very hardworking old woman who is among the few who can strive to provide for themselves at her age. Thanks for her efforts. However, she tells us that her capital is not enough to expand her business, and that's why she turned to Yehu to request a loan so as to buy more stock of cashew nuts for resale. This way she will continue to cover her expenses. Her children also contribute to her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La madre de Dominga era productora de café y fue con ella con quien comenzó a desarrollar su gusto por este cultivo. Al principio solo ayudaba a su madre en las labores de corte durante la cosecha pero con el paso de los años fue aprendiendo más cosas y pudo finalmente convertirse en productora de café. Cuando tenía veinte años Dominga se casó con Paulino quien también se dedica a esta actividad y tienen una hija. Entre los tres se encargan de sus fincas de café y durante la temporada de cosecha que es cuando tienen más trabajo llegan a contratar hasta quince personas para que los ayuden a cortar y realizar todo lo necesario para tener una mejor producción, la cual es en su totalidad de café orgánico. Dominga solicita un crédito ya que necesita realizar varias actividades en sus fincas como son labores de limpieza, comprar planta y sembrarla. Además de dedicarse al café Dominga también vende comida para así tener un ingreso extra para su familia. Al finalizar la cosecha Dominga y su esposo tienen planeado comprar una camioneta para poder salir a pasear y la cual también les servirá para transportar su café cuando sea necesario. En la fotografía Dominga está en el patio de su casa junto a su nieta a quien a veces le cuida cuando su hija está trabajando.
texts.en:
Dominga’s mother was a coffee grower, and it was with her that she started to get a taste for growing this crop. At the start she only helped her mother with the cutting tasks during the harvest, but over the years she started to learn more, and finally became a coffee grower. 

When she was 20 Dominga married Paulino, who also works in this business, and together they have a daughter. Between the three of them they look after the coffee plantations. The harvest time is when they have the most work, and hire up to 15 people who help with cutting tasks and everything else that is needed for a good harvest. All of the coffee that they grow is organic.

Dominga has requested a loan as she needs to carry out a number of activities on her plantation, such as cleaning, buying plants, and sowing coffee seeds. In addition to the coffee business, she also sells food so that she can have additional income for her family. At the end of the harvest Dominga and her husband plan to buy a van, which they will use to drive about and also to transport their coffee when required. Dominga is pictured in the patio of her house along with her granddaughter, who she sometimes looks after while her daughter is working.

loans.use: To buy and sow coffee plants.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 48 años, está casada con Augusto, de 51 años, con quien tiene seis hijos, a quienes les desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde viven es propia, la llegaron a comprar gracias a su trabajo de cada día.
Faustina y su esposo han logrado sobresalir en la venta de madera. Este es un buen negocio para ellos, ya que la gente de su localidad siempre requiere de madera para la construcción de sus casas o para las carpinterías. Esta labor la realizan hace 5 años, pero para el futuro, desean tener una carpintería para elaborar muebles, y también seguir vendiendo madera.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes debido a su responsabilidad y carácter.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles, más dinero que tiene ahorrado, podrá comprar más madera para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Faustina is 48 years old and married to Augusto, 51, with whom she has six children that she wants to offer a better quality of life.  The house where they live is their own, as they were able to buy it thanks to their daily work.  Faustina and her husband have been able to succeed through the sale of wood.  This is a good business for them, as the people in their locality always require lumber for building their homes or for carpenter’s workshops.  They have been doing this work for 5 years but, in the future, they want to have a workshop for making furniture and also to continue selling wood.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her previous credits, and also hopes to do the same this time.  She is well liked by the other members of her cooperative bank given her responsible nature and character.  With this 2,000 Peruvian soles, plus money she has saved, she will be able to buy more wood to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy more wood to continue with her work.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 34 años, está casada con Cirilo, de 36 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, ambos la compraron con las ganancias de su trabajo.
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, tienen su parcela con cultivos de cacao, hoja de coca y café. Esta labor la vienen realizando desde hace 13 años y lo que más le gusta es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es transportar los productos al lugar donde le ofrecen los mejores precios. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 34 years old and she is married to 36 year old Cirilo, with whom she has four children. The house that they live in is their own and they bought it together with their earnings from their work.

She and her husband work in agriculture. They have a plot with cacao, coca leaves and coffee crops. They have been doing this work for the past 13 years and she most enjoys harvesting as in this way she feels that the months of hard work have been rewarded with the fruits of her labor. On the other hand, the part that is most difficult is the transportation of the products to the place where the best prices are offered. In the future, she would like to buy new land to increase her crops.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she knows that if she makes her repayments on time, she will be able to gain access to another loan more easily without any complications for her communal bank.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for seven years. Besides this, Grace is also a dairy farmer, selling milk to the surrounding estates.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds. 

Grace is requesting a loan of 62,700 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cereals. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, to improve her family's standard of living. Her dream is to open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cereals.

loans.name: Ricardo Alonso

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 20 años, su padre fue quien le enseño. Además, es empleado de la fuerza armada en el país. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para hacer la instalación del agua potable en su casa y para enladrillar el piso de su casa.  Con la inversión, comprara todos los materiales que necesita para hacer las mejorar a su hogar y ofrecerle mejores condiciones a su familia, él desea continuar creciendo con su negocio para lograr una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  He has dedicated himself to carpentry for 20 years, having been taught the trade by his father.  In addition, he is a member of the country’s armed forces.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is for installing drinking water in his home, as well as laying brick for the floor.  With the investment, he will buy all the supplies he needs to make these improvements to the house and provide better living conditions for his family.  He wants to continue growing with his business to attain a higher standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to install drinking water and lay a brick floor in his house.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 28 años, su pareja es Marcelino, de 34 años, con quien tiene dos hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron juntos con el fruto de su trabajo.
Ella es agricultora, se dedica a cultivar cacao y café. Viene trabajando 9 años en esta actividad y ya cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para saber cómo lograr una buena producción. Pero considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta la ciudad donde le ofrecen los mejores precios. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes debido a su carácter amigable.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos y también contratará peones para que la apoyen en esa labor.
texts.en:
Faustina is 28 years old and her partner is Marcelino, 34, with whom she has two children.  The house they live in is their own, having bought it together with the fruits of their labor.  

She is a farmer, dedicated to growing cacao and coffee.  She has been carrying out this activity for 9 years, and now counts on the experience necessary to attain a good level of production.  She considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her crops to the city where better prices are offered.  In the future, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her crops.

This is her 6th credit with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her previous loans, and hopes to be so again this time.  She is very well liked by the other members of her cooperative bank due to her friendly character.

With the 4,000 Peruvian soles from this loan, she will buy chemical fertilizers for her crops and also hire laborers to help her with the work.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops and also to hire laborers to help her with the work.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio tiene 52 años, está casado con Bertha, de 41 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron gracias a su esfuerzo de cada día.
Su labor es labrar la tierra, cultiva cacao, café y hoja de coca. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se hace en el campo, viene trabajando 29 años y sabe que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta de ver cómo sus plantas le producen frutos saludables, con los que obtiene buenas ganancias. Florencia cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son los meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos, perjudicando a sus sembríos. 

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles comprará injertos de café para cultivar en su parcela, y también comprará abono.
texts.en:
Florencio is 52 years of age and is married to Bertha, aged 41, with whom he has five children. They live in their own house, which they managed to buy through their daily hard work.

Florencio works on the land, growing cocoa, coffee and coca leaves. He is familiar with the hard work carried out in the fields, as he has been working for 29 years. He knows that thanks to his daily efforts, today he can enjoy seeing his plants bearing healthy fruit, which he uses to obtain good profits. Florencio says that he does not like the winter much, as these months bring higher insect levels which jeopardize his crops.

This is Florencio’s 13th loan with MFP, and he knows that if he repays it on time he will be able to access another loan more easily, and without making things complicated for his communal bank. He plans to use these 3,000 Nuevos Soles to buy coffee grafts to grow on his plot of land, as well as to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy coffee grafts to grow on his plot of land, and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesugo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGO 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Albertine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Albertine est mariée à un certain Faustin et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Albertine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Albertine vend des tissus et des sous vêtements par le système de distribution. Il y a environs vingt neuf ans que Albertine exerce cette activité. Albertine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Albertine ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Albertine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGO 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The JESUGO 1 group is comprised of three persons living in the same neighborhood in Benin. Their representative, Albertine, can be see in the photos raising her hand. Albertine is married to a man named Faustin and has four children, all educated and under her responsiblity. Albertine herself rarely attended school. She has been selling cloth and under garments through a distributin system for the last nine years. She stocks up on merchandise in the markets in Benin. In order to increase her sales activity, Albertine hopes to build up her stock, thus allowing her to better repons to the requests of her customers. In order to do this, Albertine and the members of the JESUGO 1 group are asking for a loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: purchase cloth and under garments

loans.name: Allognon Group

texts.fr: ALLOGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Yawovi Rosaline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Victor. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et dont deux restent à leur charge. Yawovi Rosaline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Yawovi Rosaline a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de dix ans que Yawovi Rosaline mène comme activité la vente de divers articles (sucre et maïs) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Yawovi Rosaline vend des sacs et des chaussures. Yawovi Rosaline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Yawovi Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Yawovi Rosaline sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ALLOGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: ALLOGNON is a group composed of three friends who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Yawovi Rosaline (seen in the photo with her hand raised), is 39 years old and married to a man named Victor. The couple have three children, all educated, two of which are under their responsibility. Yawovi Rosaline and her husband live with their children and together take care of the needs of their children. Yawovi Rosaline herself left school at the primary level. For the last ten years, Yawovi Rosaline has been seeling various products (sugar and maize) in her neighborhood. She also sells bags and shoes. She is passionate about these businesses, which enable her to attend to the needs of her children. She stocks up on merchandise at the market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, Yawovi Rosaline and the other memebers of the ALLOGNON group are asking for their third loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to respond to customer requests and achieve higher profits. The first two loans were satisfactorily reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase diverse good products (sugar and maize), evening bags and shoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer laboriosa, junto a su esposo Gualberto pudo obtener su casa propia, donde ahora viven con sus cuatro hijos.
Su actividad es la agricultura, cultiva cacao, hoja de coca y café. Viene labrando la tierra desde hace 18 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo. En los tiempos de cosecha tienen la ayuda de jornaleros, para que de esa manera logren terminar el recojo de manera rápida. Su producto más rentable es el cacao, porque sus granos son de primera calidad y los vende en las asociaciones acopiadoras donde le gratifican a muy buenos precios. Para el futuro, aspira comprar más terrenos y seguir sembrando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por lo cual se siente agradecida de esta oportunidad que le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por ser muy puntual en sus pagos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará plantas de cacao para cultivarlas en su parcela.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hard-working woman who, along with her husband Gualberto, was able to buy her own house, where they now live with their four children. She works in agriculture, growing cocoa, coca leaves and coffee. She has been working on the land for 18 years, and does so with the help of her husband. 

During the harvest Francisca is helped by day laborers, so that she can finish her harvest quickly. Her most profitable item is cocoa, because she produces top-quality grains and sells them to middle men, who pay very good prices. In the future, she would like to buy more land so that she can continue growing, which will allow her to help her children get ahead.

This is Francisca’s eighth loan with MFP, and she is thankful for this opportunity as it allows her to improve her living conditions. She is a well-respected member of her communal bank, as she is a very prompt payer. She plans to use this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy more cocoa plants to grow on her plot of land.

loans.use: To buy cocoa plants to grow on her plot of land.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie is 23 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. 

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more clothes for resale. The profits from her business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre responsable y muy dedicado a su familia, tiene 37 años y está  casado con Teofila, de 43 años. Juntos tienen tres hijos, a quienes desean brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron gracias a su trabajo.
Gracias a los años que él trabajaba en el campo logró abrir una tienda para que su esposa trabaje en su vivienda. Su bodega ya tiene 3 años y comenta que siempre hay ingresos, ya que la gente de su comunidad acude diariamente a realizar sus compras para preparar sus alimentos. En su tienda vende conservas, verduras, carnes, cereales, entre otros, pero cuando se terminan sus productos es cuando acude a MFP para abastecerse. Con el tiempo, anhelan ampliar su negocio vendiendo al por mayor.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y una vez más agradece por la confianza que le brindan, ya que es una persona responsable con sus pagos. En su banco comunal se lleva muy bien con los socios, por lo que es un ejemplo a seguir.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de diversos productos para su tienda como conservas, bebidas, verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a responsible man who is highly dedicated to his family. He is 27 years of age and married to Teofila, who is 43. Together they have three children, and they want to make sure that they have a good quality of life. They own the house where they live, which they bought thanks to their work.

Thanks to the years that Guillermo spent working in the field, he was able to open a store in his home, where his wife works. He opened the store three years ago, and says that there is always income as the local people visit him daily to buy the items they need to prepare their meals. He sells canned goods, vegetables, meat, cereals and other items in the store, and when he runs out of stock he goes to MFP so that he can buy supplies. Over time, Guillermo and his wife would like to expand their business to sell wholesale.

This is Guillermo’s 14th loan with MFP, and once again he has expressed his gratitude for the trust placed in him. He is a very responsible person with his payments, and gets on well with the other members of his communal bank, so is an example to follow. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, Guillermo plans to buy various products for his store such as canned goods, drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy various products for his store such as canned goods, drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MANSAVO est formé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Colette Agossi , est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Colette Agossi est mariée à un matelassier du nom de André. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Colette Agossi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Colette Agossi exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits par le système de distribution, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Colette Agossi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Colette Agossi désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Colette Agossi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MANSAVO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group MANSAVO is comprised of two persons living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Colette Agossi, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. This is the third time that the group asks for financial support from Alidé in order to augment their activity level. Colette Agossi is married to a mattress-maker named André. The couple have three children, a few of whom attend school and all of whom are under their responsibility. The couple live with their children and together take care of the family's needs. Colette Agossi did not attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling various products through a distribution system, which has allowed her to fairly easily take care of the needs of her family. She stocks up on merchandise at a market in Benin. In order to better respond to the needs of her customers, Colette Agossi would like to diversify the products she sells. In order to achieve this she and the members of MANSAVO are asking for their third loan from Alidé. The first two were successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase diverse products.

loans.name: Aglo-Boe Group

texts.fr: AGLO-BOE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Houissigbo Lucie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un transporteur du nom de Moïse. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et quatre à leur charge. Houissigbo Lucie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Houissigbo Lucie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Houissigbo Lucie mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot et farine de manioc) à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Houissigbo Lucie s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Houissigbo Lucie sollicite un crédit avec les membres du groupe AGLO-BOE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: AGLO-BOE is a group composed of three friends. The representative of the group, Houissigbo Lucie (seen in the photo raising her hand) is 46 years old and married to a man named Moise who works in transportation. The couple have five children, a few of whom are education, and four of whom are under their responsiblity. Houissigbo Lucie herself did not attend school. For the past ten years, she has been selling diverse products (corn, beans and manioc flour) from her home, which has allowed her to take care of her needs as well as those of her children. She stocks up on merchandise in the region of Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and achieve higher profits, Houissigbo Lucie and the members of AGLO-BOE are asking for a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: purchase corn, beans and manioc flour.

loans.name: Loice Khayanje

texts.en:
Loice is a mother of two who runs a beauty salon, a business she started 14 years ago for which she now earns a monthly income of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She has requested her sixth loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD to purchase two hair dryers for her salon, as well as hair weaves and braids. 

The profit from her business will help her to educate her children, as well as to buy additional stock. She hopes to continue with this business in order to give her children the best in life.

loans.use: To purchase two salon hair dryers, hair weaves and braids.

loans.name: Kathem

texts.en:
Kathem is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has eight children, one of whom is employed.

Kathem owns a grocery store and sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2005 and now has one employee. He is well experienced in this field and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a refrigerator and install a rolling shutter in his store. He also wants to make signage for his shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can be able to offer better life conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install a rolling shutter in his store.

loans.name: Titomangba Group

texts.fr: TITOMANGBA est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sèwanoudé Suzanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 56 ans et est une veuve. Sèwanoudé Suzanne est mère d’un enfant non scolarisé et à sa charge. Sèwanoudé Suzanne vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Sèwanoudé Suzanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Sèwanoudé Suzanne vend des céréales (soja et haricot) de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Sèwanoudé Suzanne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sèwanoudé Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Sèwanoudé Suzanne sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe TITOMANGBA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: TITOMANGBA is a group composed of two persons living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Sèwanoudé Suzanne (seen with her hand raised in the photo) is a 56 year old widow. She is the mother of one uneducated child who is under her responsibility. She lives alone with her child and tends to the needs of the family. She herself did not attend school. For the last 15 years, Sèwanoudé Suzanne has been selling cereals (soy and beans) from her home. She is passionate about this activity, which allows her to address her needs and those of her child. She stocks up on products at the markets in Benin. In order to better satisfy the needs of her cutomers and in order to increase her level of activity, Sèwanoudé Suzanne and the members of TITOMANGBA is asking for her fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were all successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase soybeans and other beans

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de ganado; pero desde hace unos 14 años trabaja en la agricultura con ayuda de su padre. Posteriormente, lo realizaba en compañía de su hijo cultivan 4,900 metros cuadrados de maíz; pero lastimosamente su hijo falleció y don Daniel solo cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz él solo. 

Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su vivienda, para llegar ahí, debe pagar un vehiculo para trasladarse a su casa, una vez llega a su casa con las compras paga a una carreta halada por bueyes para trasladar los insumos al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a dos kilómetros de distancia de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra. Con el objetivo de mejorar su cultivo de maíz y el nivel de vida de su familia con el incremento en la producción. Él desea que sus otros hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years of age, married, and has four children. From a very young age he has worked buying and selling livestock, but for the past 14 years he has also worked in agriculture with the help of his father. He then moved on to working with his son, growing 4,900 square meters of corn. Sadly, his son passed away, and Daniel now grows 7,000 square meters of corn by himself.

Daniel gets his agricultural inputs in a city located four kilometers from his home. To get there, he has to pay for a vehicle to travel back home. Once he gets home with his purchase, he has to pay for a cart pulled by oxen to take the inputs to the area where his crops are grown, which is located two kilometers away.

The loan Daniel has requested from Fundación Campo will be used to buy fertilizers and manure and to pay labor expenses. He will do this in order to improve his corn-growing business and his family’s quality of life, and he hopes that his other children can finish their university education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure and to pay labor expenses.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La is 39 years old and single. She lives in Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham district. She is a rice farmer, which she has been doing for 19 years. She also raises pigs at home and works for others for a fee. She earns about 19,000 KHR a day. The drought and insects are the main factors lowering her production. 

La's group is requesting its first loan for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, La's loan will be used to buy fertilizer and to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to increase her yield and earn a higher income, so she can upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
Ángela María, María Teresa y Carlos conforman al grupo Mil Flores; ellos son  originarios de Masaya.  La coordinadora del grupo es Ángela, mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio hace 6 años con la venta de chiverías y poco a poco fue aumentándola hasta tener una pulpería.
“comprare arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, papel higiénico, avena, sopa magi, sardina” menciono Ángela al preguntarle en que invertiría el crédito. 
María Teresa desde hace 15 años vende platanitos y enchiladas y Carlos se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 9 años.
texts.en:
Ángela María, María Teresa, and Carlos form the group Mil Flores; they are native to Masaya. The group coordinator is Ángela, a hard-working and enterprising woman who began six years ago with the sale of treats, and little by little grew her business until she had a small grocery store.
“I will buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, toilet paper, oatmeal, Maggi soup, sardines,” Ángela mentioned when asked in what she would invest the loan.
María Teresa has sold bananas and enchiladas for 15 years, and Carlos has made a living through the sale of footwear for 9 years.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, toilet paper, oatmeal, Maggi soup, sardines.

loans.name: Dúo Campo Alto Group

texts.es: Dúo Campo Alto,  este grupo está integrado por la señora Sonia ella es originaria de Totonicapán ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y como actividad secundaria también se dedica a la cultivación y venta de café, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa típica y también para la cultivación de café. Desde ya les agradece por la ayuda que le brindan.
texts.en:
Dúo Campo Alto, this group includes Sonia. She is originally from Totonicapán. She makes a living through the sale of traditional clothing, and as a secondary activity she also makes a living through the cultivation and sale of coffee.  

She is requesting this loan to buy traditional food and also to cultivate coffee. She thanks you in advance for the help you will provide her.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes and also to cultivate coffee.

loans.name: Consepter

texts.en:
Consepter is 29 years old and she is married to Douglas. They have been blessed with three children aged six, four and one year, respectively. She has been running a beauty salon alongside a retail shop for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000 from these businesses. 

She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a hair dryer, hair braids and weaves to use in her business. 

The profits from her beauty salon will help expand both her businesses. She hopes to do well in this business, as well as acquire a piece of land and build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer, hair braids and weaves.

loans.name: Kou-Masse Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KOU-MASSE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Elise est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Guillaume. Le couple a quatre enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Elise n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix ans environs que Elise mène comme activité la vente de bouillie accompagnée de bateau de blé de de façon ambulante. Elise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Elise et les autres membres du groupe KOU-MASSE sollicitent ensemble un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The KOU-MASSE group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. 

Elise (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. This is the first time that the group is seeking the financial support of ALIDé, in order to expand their business. Elise is married to a welder named Guillaume. The couple has four children, and they both provide for the various household needs. Elise lives with her husband and children. She did not receive schooling.

Elise is an itinerant vendor and has been selling porridge and flour for about ten years now. She stocks up at a market in Benin. Since the demand from her customers is growing and seeing that their resources are limited, Elise, along with the other members of the KOU-MASSE group, is seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and 	hibiscus flower

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
A young 20-year-old mother of two little children originally from Kror Kor district (Cambodia), Nuon has supported her family by growing rice. To earn additional income, she also produces palm sugar. Her husband helps her in this business by gathering the palm juice for her. Having been in this business for three years, she earns almost 12,000 KHR per day. 

For Nuon, the previous loan was her first, and she has completely paid back the entire loan. Her first loan helped her to earn a better living and relieved her family's financial burden by enabling her to earn a decent income from her business. Now, she and three other members have joined together to request a micro group loan, and she is the group leader. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business and maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He is the only provider for the family. Yousef owns a shop for renting chairs and utensils. He established his business in 2010, and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting 2,400 USD loan to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 50 years old and blessed with five children. He is a livestock trader in Suswa area in Narok town. He has been running his business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

He has borrowed his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase animals for sale
