loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be an honest and hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of clothes within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Giulbakhar

texts.en:
Giulbakhar is 54 years old and lives in the Gardabani district with her family: her husband and two children (14 and 15 years old). The children go to the local school. Giulbakhar’s husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. 

The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they rent a plot of land where broom plants are grown. They then produce brooms and sell them at the local open market. Giulbakhar also runs a store where she trades in clothing and shoes.  

With the requested loan, she plans to water the broom plants, weed and pay for workers. The other part of the loan will be used for adding more variety of clothes and shoes to Giulbakhar’s shop. This will increase the sales and income of the family. With the increased income, Giulbakhar will make the family house more comfortable and improve the living conditions of the family. 

Giulbakhar is a hardworking woman. She is hoping to generate profit from this loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to water the broom plants, weed and pay workers. She will also add more variety of clothes and shoes to her shop.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married to Florence, a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past 18 years with the monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.  

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Nicasio will use the loan to buy more goats and sheep for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land for large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ” iniciará el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Persidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de repuestos de cocina,  venta de chicharrón y papas fritas, venta de plásticos en general, venta de gelatina, costura de chamarras, tejido de chompas, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura, ella nos cuenta que hace varios años trabajo en un taller de costura como operaria, ahorrándose decidió sacar su propio taller y ser independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas e hilos) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Zapatito Veloz communal bank will start its 11th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, working with one of the organization’s regional offices in Collpani. This group has right members, and is led by a management board headed by Nancy. The members of this communal bank carry out various businesses, including food sales, kitchen item sales, pork crackling and potato chip sales, general plastic sales, gelatin sales, jacket sewing, sweater-making and furniture sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-business owners such as Nancy. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago, having been invited by a friend who is also a member of the association. Nancy currently has a dressmaking business, and says that various years ago she worked in a sewing workshop, but decided to save and open her own workshop and become more independent.

The loan Nancy has now applied for is to increase her capital (buying fabrics and threads), which she will purchase from distribution companies and then use to make items to sell on order. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, as she is married with three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nancy responded that she likes the training given on loans and health.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Los Rincones Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Rincones lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes se dedican al comercio de productos lácteos, crianza de pollo y pulpería.  La coordinadora del grupo es Lidieth quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en la actualidad vende productos lácteos (queso, crema, cuajada) a por mayor.
El crédito lo invertirá en queso, cuajada y crema.
Las otras integrantes son Ángela quien tiene una pulpería  y Nohelia quien se dedica a la crianza de pollo.
texts.en:
The Los Rincones group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.  They devote themselves to selling dairy products, raising chickens, and a grocery store.

Lidieth is the coordinator of the group.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  She is currently selling dairy products (cheese, cream, curds) wholesale.  She will invest the loan in cheese, curds, and cream.

The other members of the group are Ángela, who has a grocery store, and Nohelia, who raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Botum's Group

texts.en: Botum, 37, is a citizen from a rural area of Battambang province's Thmor Kol district. To support her four children who are currently students, she and her husband has been working as rice farmers. This is Botum's fifth loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She has succeeded in improving her lifestyle gradually. Now, Botum forms a group of two to seek a new loan; her co-member has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She is asking for 700,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop in a timely fashion and make more profit in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en:
Raghida is a 41-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and four children, who attend school. She, with her husband, manages the family’s household expenses. Her husband began working at a local company two years ago. He earns a barely fair income. Raghida decided to start her own home business because she wanted to add to the family's income. She started her business selling cosmetic products on a free-lance basis and has customers from all over the neighboring areas.
 
Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks, blushes, and many other items. She notes that this will boost her sales, therefore her revenues, thus her way of living. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty products shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks, blushes, etc.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Hashem owns a shop for making aluminum doors and cabinets. He established his business in 2010 after ten years of experience in the same field. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a machine specialized for his work and a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work and a generator.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 52 years old, widowed, and blessed with children, who are all above 18 years. She has practiced poultry keeping and owned rental houses for the last seven years and gets an income of KES 14,000 per month.

She has got good credit history with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, from which she plans to buy poultry feed. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to educate her children through college and build more houses for rental purposes.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
This is Hamza, a 27-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Alaa, an adorable young lady and the mother of his small child. 

Hamzah is his family’s only support; they do depend on him after suffering from a bad financial situation. He decided to have his own business a few years ago. In that way he will be able to increase his income and therefore cover the family's expenses. So he opened a football playground in his own land. He benefits from its rental fees to carry on his life in a proper way.
 
Today, he has the intention to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to be able to purchase an electrical generator. He confirms that this will allow him to rent the football playground at night as well. He is sure that with a little bit of care, he can better develop his business and -- the most important thing -- increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has applied for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Esther will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, and wheat flour.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Carlos De Jesús

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde la edad de ocho años se dedica a la agricultura, su papá desde muy pequeño le enseño. Hoy que es padre de familia le ha servido de mucho lo que aprendió. Él, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para preparar su equipo de trabajo, se toma su taza de café y luego camina treinta minutos para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, se queda trabajando durante ocho horas, luego regresa a su casa entre la 1:00 y las 2:00 p.m. así es su rutina diaria y cuando tiene mucho trabajo regresa a su lugar de trabajo por la tarde. 

Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad, para llegar ahí, debe caminar por unas veredas alrededor de quince minutos, después aborda un autobús que tarda unos treinta y cinco minutos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un saco de fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra. La inversión será de gran ayuda, por la razón que sembrara sus cultivos ya que tiene el lugar donde los realizara y le faltan los insumos. Espera obtener una buena cosecha para que sus ganancias mejoren; a fin de ahorrar y proporcionarle el estudio a sus hijos, ya que él no pudo por la pobreza en que vivían sus padres y también desea dejarles un lugar propio donde vivir, pues donde están viviendo no es de él.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old, married and has two children. He has been working in farming since the age of eight. His father taught him at an early age. Today as father of a family what he learned has been useful. He gets up at 4:30 AM to get his tools ready, He drinks his cup of coffee and later walks thirty minutes to his workplace. He works for eight hours, and returns home between 1:00PM and 2:00PM. This is his daily routine, but when he has a lot of work he returns to work in the afternoon.

He buys agricultural supplies in the city, and to get there, he needs to walk along the footpaths about fifteen minutes, and then take a bus ride of about thirty-five minutes.

The loan that he is asking for through Fundación Campo, is to buy a bag of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and to pay for labor. The investment will be a big help, for the reason that he could plant his crops in the place that he already has but he lacks the supplies. He hopes to have a good harvest in order to improve his earnings, in order to save and afford to educate his children, which he was not because of the poverty he lived in with his parents, and also he hopes to leave them a place of their own to live, as where they are living does not belong to him.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is from Iraq. He is a youth client age 29, single, and lives with a family of six members, four of who are employed. Rawad owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2008 and he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old, married to David, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling construction materials like timber and nails for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Beatrice will use the loan to buy more timber and nails for sale to her customers. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to own a show room for furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28 year old Lebanese engaged man. He’s living with his parents and one sibling, who works. His father is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. Unlike others in his age, Mohammad started to work very early, expecting to help his father with their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2002 on a freelance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services.

Today, he’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business. He notes that he’s willing to take bigger projects and that this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD of KES 60,000. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 32 years old. She sells children's clothing and has been in this business for four years. 

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more children's clothing for resale. The profits from her business will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is from the small town of Rustavi, East Georgia. She is 41 years old. Elza is married and lives with two grown sons. 

The family earns a living through a dairy business. In particular, they have three milk cows. Elza milks the cows and produces cheese. She sells milk and cheese locally. Elza is a very hardworking woman, but she still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.
 
She requested a loan to purchase food for cattle. With this credit, she will purchase lucerne (alfalfa), which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Elza will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Kuntora

texts.en:
Kuntora is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five people. 

He has been a maize farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

He is servicing his fifth business loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd., with which he intends to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to own a combine harvester.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single and lives with a family of seven members, three of who are employed.

Haidar owns a grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,400 loan to buy three refrigerators and a generator. He also wants to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy three refrigerators and a generator. He also wants to install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Himam

texts.en:
Himam is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 29 years. He is married and has two children. His brother lives with him and he is employed.
 
Himam is a photographer. He established his business in 2011 and he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,400 youth loan to renovate his shop and install shutters. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and install shutters.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old, comes from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married with one child who is 17 years old.

Miriam is a farmer and has been in farming for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labor.

She hopes to be able to buy a piece of land for farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 23 years old. She is married and has one child aged two years. She sells ladies' clothes. Her husband works as a businessman. She wants the loan to add more different types of clothes to the business. The profits from the business will be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale in the business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old. He is single but supports his siblings aged 10 and 16 years old. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.


This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to pay school fees for his siblings.

Joseph hopes to have a stable income so as to manage repaying the fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 51 years old. She is a mother of two children aged 18 and 20 years old. Both her children attend school. She owns a shop which she has been running for five years. With the loan, she will buy more items for sale such as sugar, beans and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Dúo Tu Eres Mi Cielo Group

texts.es: Dúo Tu eres mi cielo,  este grupo está integrado por la señora Alicia tiene 4 años de dedicarse a bordar  y a tejer artículos típicos, también como actividad secundaria se dedica a la crianza de pollos, agradece a Fape la ayuda que le han brindado ya que le ha servido de mucho para salir adelante, espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado. Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa típica, y para la compra de pollos para la crianza.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Dúo Tu Eres Mi Cielo group.  She has been embroidering and knitting typical items for four years.  As a secondary business activity she raises chickens.

She is grateful to Fape for the help given to her.  It has served her well in order to get ahead.  She hopes that they can help her again with the requested loan.  She is requesting this loan to buy typical clothing and to buy chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing and to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Iasin

texts.en:
Iasin is 33 years old and lives in the Gardabani district. He has a wife, a mother and two children in his family. 

Iasin works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. He is involved in agricultural business as well. In particular, he has a plot of land where greens are grown. Iasin sells greens locally. In addition, he has four calves and takes good care of them. Iasin is a very hardworking man with rich experience in his work.

He requested a loan to purchase food for cattle. With this credit, he will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the calves during the fall and winter seasons. Since the calves will be fed properly in winter, Iasin will be able to slaughter them and sell the meat at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Iasin will improve the living conditions of the family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been selling timber and also making sawdust for sale as a primary business and doing mixed-crop farming as a secondary business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 13,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy more timber, a saw mill machine and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business. His hopes to venture into tea farming and to build a premise for his saw mill business.

loans.use: To buy trees for timber, a saw mill machine and seedlings.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 27 years and single. He lives with a family of four members, two of whom are employed.

Mohamad is a cowman and has a small farm. He has acquired this profession by working with his father for several years. In 2000, he established his own small farm. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1,500 youth loan to build a cowshed. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to build a cowshed.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a father of three children, aged between 6 and 11; all of them are enrolled in schools. He is a tailor and has been tailoring for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more fabrics to use in his tailoring business. He plans to use the extra profits for savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Assoumpta

texts.en: Assoumpta is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells beans and cooking oil. She has spent two years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more items such as maize flour and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 44 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she wants to add more charcoal, beans, bananas and cassava flour to her inventory for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, beans, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 33 years old. She is married to a driver. They have six children aged between 3 and 15. Three of them go to school. Jeannette plans to use the loan for buying more spare parts for cars and motorbikes. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for cars and motobikes for sale.

loans.name: Emeritha

texts.en: Emeritha is aged 36. She is married with three children. She sells potatoes and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more tons for potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en: Telesphore, who is 41 years old, sells beans and rice. With this loan, he will buy more beans and rice for resale. His profits from the business will be put toward buying a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline, a 31-year-old mother of three, is married to a mechanic. With this loan, she wants to buy more motorbike spare parts for resale. She plans to put the profits toward savings.

loans.use: to buy more motorbike spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Desde la edad de ocho años se dedica a la agricultura, su papá desde muy pequeño le enseño. Después que murió su papá, trabajo con su mamá ejerciendo la misma labor agrícola. Actualmente vive junto a su mamá y su hermana. Ellos se dedican a sembrar maíz, fríjol, maicillo, pipían  y tomate. Se levantan muy temprano para iniciar con sus labores. Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo camina diez minutos,  trabaja unas seis horas junto a su mamá, luego regresan a la hora del almuerzo ya que su hermana esta estudiando. 

Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad, para llegar ahí, debe caminar unos quince minutos, después aborda un autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra. La inversión será de gran ayuda, por la razón que sembrara 14,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo ya que con sus propios recursos solo le alcanza para sembrar el maíz y él desea cultivar también el maicillo. Su objetivo, es trabajar mucho para ahorrar y comprarse un terreno en donde construirá su casa y ayudar a que su hermana se gradué de técnico en enfermería.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 year of age, and is single. He has worked in agriculture since he was 8 years old, and was taught this work by his father from a very young age. Since his father died he has worked with his mother, continuing with this same agricultural business. 

Miguel currently lives with his mother and sister, and they work growing corn, beans, sorghum, squash and tomatoes. He walks 10 minutes to get to his place of work, and works six hours per day alongside his mother. They then go home at lunch time, as his sister studies. Miguel gets his agricultural inputs in the city, and to get there he has to walk about 15 minutes before taking a bus.

He has requested this loan from Fundación Campo to buy four bags of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, and to pay labor expenses. This money will be of great help to him, and he will use it to sow 14,000 square meters of sorghum. With his own resources, he would only be able to plant corn, and he also wants to grow sorghum. His aim is to work a lot to save, so he can buy a plot of land where he can build a house, as well as helping his sister who is studying to be a nurse.

loans.use: To buy four bags of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, and to pay labor expenses.

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los animales los hace crecer y engordar y luego lo vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 17 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, antes la socia se dedicaba al negocio de restaurant pero no le fue muy bien es por eso que se dedico al negocio de crianza de animales, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y alimentos para los animales.
La socias que están pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo después porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de venta de verduras y negocio de venta de vinos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Qorilazo communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Marcelina, age 33, is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She works in her business of raising and selling animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens the animals so that they grow, and then she sells them at the different markets.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had this business for 17 years, and it is going very well for her.

She was in the restaurant business, but that did not go very well for her.  Therefore, she is now in the business of raising animals.  Her dream is to have a place where she could sell the animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

The members in the inset photo group had their picture taken later as they asked permission to do so due to work.

The other members' businesses include selling food, a grocery store, taxi service, selling vegetables, and selling wine.

Marcelina is thankful to those who form part of her dream through the loans, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Shakhraia

texts.en:
Shakhraia is 64 years old and lives in the Gardabani district. She has a pensioner mother in her family. 

Shakhraia is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, she owns a plot of land where tomatoes and greens are grown. In addition, she has a small dairy farm with two milk cows and four calves. Shakhraia produces cheese. She sells her agricultural products at the local open market. Shakhraia works hard from early morning till late evening to improve the conditions of her family.
 
She requested a loan to build a cattle shed. Shakhraia plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the cattle shed is built, Shakhraia will be able to expand her dairy farm and sell more production. This will increase the income of the family. She plans to reinvest her income in her agricultural business and expand it. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 29 years old. She sells eggs and meat. She has been in the business for seven years. With the loan, she will buy more eggs and meat for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and meat for sale.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 37 years old. She is married and has five children aged between three and fourteen. With the loan, she wants to buy more electronic items such as TV sets and radios. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy TV sets and radios for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Kalisya

texts.en:
Kalisya is a twenty-six-year-old hard-working man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells cassava flour to mostly traders from the city and with the profits earned he has been able to provide basics to his family. Some of the cassava he uses he gets from his own garden and also buys from other farmers then takes to the milling machine to make cassava flour. He has a personal goal of educating his children to the University level and his business desire is to sell over 100 sacks of cassava flour per month despite the seasonal nature of the product.

Kalisya intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph, a 28-year-old married father of one child, lives in Masindi, Uganda. For four years Asaph has been a civil servant working for the local government, and with his meager salary he has been able to buy land and enroll in higher education.

In order to diversify his income sources, he set up a drug shop where he earns 50,000 shillings per week. Like most businesses in the country, he faces the challenge of price fluctuation as well as the spread of fake goods on the market that risk his business reputation.

Asaph's dream is to educate his child, upgrade his education so as to get promotions at work, diversify his business and move it to a more permanent location. Asaph intends to use this loan to pay his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison au Bénin. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Séraphine est âgée de 23 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé, et tous à leur charge. Séraphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Séraphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Séraphine mène comme activité la vente des poissons de façon ambulante. Séraphine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans. Séraphine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Séraphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayidote group has three members, who all live in the same house in Benin. This is the sixth time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business activity. 

The group’s representative is called Séraphine, and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 23 years of age, and is married to a reseller called Marcellin. The couple has two children, one of whom is at school and both are under their care. Séraphine did not go to school, and lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. 

To cover her various expenses, Séraphine works selling fish on the street, and has done so for the past eight years. She gets her supplies in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and her income, Séraphine and the rest of the members of the Ayidote group have requested their sixth loan from Alidé. This loan will be used to buy more product stock and increase their customer bases. The group’s previous loans have all been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Sonangnon Group

texts.fr: SONANGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Jeanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Corneille. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Jeanne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix ans que Jeanne mène comme activité la vente des poissons à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des boules de pâtes faites à base de l’amidon du maïs. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SONANGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sonangnon is a group with 3 members, who are all friends. Jeanne, the representative of the group (pictured with her hand raised) is 38 years old and married to a tailor named Corneille. They have three children, some of whom attend school, and all of whom are their dependents. In addition to their children, Jeanne and Corneille have another child in their care.

Jeanne and her husband live with their children and together take care of the various household responsibilities. Jeanne did not attend school. She has been in the business of selling fish out of her home for almost 10 years. 

Jeanne's secondary business is selling balls of dough made from a base of corn starch. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers, Jeanne is requesting her fifth loan with the other members of the Sonangnon group. This loan will help them to better meet customer demand and to make more profit. Their previous loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and fish

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 40-year-old man who lives in Masindi, Uganda with his wife and four children. Six years ago, he decided to go into business selling produce and has done so well that some local schools have asked him to supply them with produce. He earned the money he needed to start his current business by working as a farmer. His main business challenge is inadequate capital to buy new stock to sell to his customers. His dreams for the future are to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Now that the summer holidays are now over, Godfrey is preparing to supply maize to local schools and has requested this loan to buy additional supplies of the grain to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to supply to schools.

loans.name: Ziyada

texts.en: Ziyada is 62 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and the mother of five children. Several years ago, she decided to venture into farming, and started on a small scale but is now one of the best-known commercial farmers in her area. Like all farmers in developing countries, her business is affected by unskilled labor and poor farming practices caused by a lack of capital needed to engage in more modern farming. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to buy more land so she can raise a larger crop. Ziyada is requesting a loan to pay workers to harvest her maize crop.

loans.use: to hire laborers to harvest her maize garden.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. For five years, he has been operating a bar and salon that he started with his personal savings. Seventy per cent of his workers are unskilled, and the lack of good customer care personnel is a problem since his business is service-based. His dream is to have adequate capital to hire skilled customer care workers. As a good parent, he wishes to educate his children and to build a brick house, since his family is currently living in a mud wattled dwelling. His business dreams are to venture into farming and modernize his bar and salon business. Edward is requesting a loan to buy beer and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen makes excellent use of loans and is very prompt in making payments. He is a 53-year-old married man with eight children who lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His goal for his family is to educate all of his children so they can attain degrees. His current business is selling a local gin that he prepares himself despite challenges such as continuous price fluctuations. His dream is to expand his business into new markets. He says that his business is usually at the boom stage during the holiday season. Stephen needs the loan to buy bananas, which he uses to make gin to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bananas to make gin to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora,ella enseña el nivel secundario y tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania como chompas,polos,sombreros y guantes,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicirta el credito para comprar artesania como polos,chompas,guantes y sombreros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
On top of continuing teaching in a high school, Martha keeps on running her crafts sales activity, selling articles such as sweaters, polo shirts, hats and gloves. She has been engaged in this retailing activity for 6 years, and she dreams of expanding her craft selling activity. She is requesting  a loan to buy crafts such as polo shirts, sweaters, gloves and hats.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts, sweaters, gloves and hats.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Marina vive en la ciudad de Managua, Nicaragua.  Es madre soltera de  dos niños.
Doña Gloria tiene un club de  medicina natural  ella oferta productos Herbalife a personas con problemas de salud en el organismo, ofrece soluciones como:( nutrición. Omega tres, fibra activa para el estreñimiento, multivitamínica, te herbal, Aloe, guaraná, batidos en sus cuatros sabores: fresa, galleta, chocolate, vainilla). 
Decidió ofertar  ya que este  producto  tiene un costo alto al comprarlo en envase sellado es por esta razón  que ella lo  vende en porciones pequeñas como en   batidos  preparados de diferentes productos,  ya que los clientes llegan al negocio por el batido. Las personas eligen según su problema de salud el producto adecuado.
 
Gloria dice que con los créditos  ha podido mantener la variedad de los productos y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes ya que el  éxito de  su negocio está en mantener todo tipo de productos de Herbalife. 
El horario de atención es desde la 7:30 de la mañana hasta 7:30 de la noche.

Este crédito lo esta solicitando para comprar  diferentes productos de Herbalife y poder  así preparar sus batidos y poder ayudar en parte a las personas a mejorar su salud. Agradece a KIVA y CAPRODEL, por el apoyo y espera le puedan conceder este préstamo para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Gloria Marina lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is the single mother of two children.

Gloria has a natural medicine club. She offers Herbalife products to people with health problems. She offers solutions such as nutrition, omega-3, active fiber for constipation, multivitamins, herbal tea, aloe, guaraná, and four flavors of shakes: strawberry, cookie, chocolate, and vanilla.

She decided to offer this since this product has a high cost when purchased in a sealed container. This is why she sells it in small portions, such as in shakes prepared from different products, since customers come to the business for the shake. People choose the appropriate product according to their health problem.

Gloria says that with the loans she has been able to maintain a variety of products and keep her clients happy, since the success of the business is in maintaining all kinds of Herbalife products. 

Her business hours are from 7:30 in the morning until 7:30 at night.

She is asking for this loan to buy different Herbalife products and thus be able to prepare her shakes and be able to help people improve their health in part. She thanks Kiva and CEPRODEL for the support and hopes that they will be able to give her this loan to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase different Herbalife (shakes) and natural medicine products

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard used the previous loan to buy salt and sugar to sell, and with the profits he was able to re-invest in his business. He is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children while his business dream is to open a wholesale shop. He operates a retail shop, which he started four years ago. His business is challenged by lack of adequate capital to meet the high demand. Richard needs this loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Faith 2 Group

texts.en: Samuel is a 48-year-old married man with eight children who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He leads a loan group whose members came together because they have similar economic and social interests. Samuel has been practicing farming for 18 years, and uses his income to pay school fees for his children and buy more land for farming. His business is affected by fluctuations in weather and prices, and by inflation. His dream is to educate his children, build a permanent home and modernize his farming activities. Samuel intends to use his portion of this loan to buy seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Midovivenou Group

texts.fr: MIDOVIVENOU est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Madeleine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix ans que Madeleine mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs) dans un quartier du Bénin. Madeleine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite un septième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MIDOVIVENOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Midovivenou is a group of two individuals living the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Madeleine (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 42 years old and married to Gregoire, a carpenter. They have five children, some of whom are in school and two of whom are still in the couple’s care. Madeleine and her husband live together with their children and jointly provide for various household needs. Madeleine did not attend school. For almost 10 years, Madeleine has been selling food (rice and cornmeal mash) in a neighborhood of Benin. Madeleine enjoys her work that allows her to support herself and her children. Madeleine stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Madeleine, along with the other member of the Midovivenou group, is seeking a seventh loan. This laon will allow the group members to better meet customer demand and increase their revenues. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice.

loans.name: Banaba Center Group

texts.en:
Erlinda is widowed with five children. She is 61 years old and lives in Lenienza, Pagadian City.

Erlinda has a general store where she sells dry goods and canned goods to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 15,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business and somehow make it a department store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as canned goods and dry goods.

loans.name: Eduvijes Group

texts.en:
Eduvijes is 68 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Eduvijes has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Eduvijes has requested a loan to be used in purchasing more raw ingredients and snacks to sell.

Eduvijes has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Eduvijes hopes to be engaged in another type of business. Eduvijes is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 39 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with 3 children. 
To earn a living, Gena has a business selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about PHP 3800 each month doing this type of work. Gena has requested a loan of 30000 to  purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Gena has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: José Elias

texts.es: José Elías, es originario de paraje el sauce  tiene 22 años de edad agradece a fape y kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que este es su segundo crédito que solicita y le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio, ya  que se dedica a la venta de artículos de usos domésticos, como ponchos, vajillas de peltre, trajes típicos, y también artículos de plástico, a adelantado pagos para poder cancelar y así solicitar un nuevo crédito, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de  ponchos, vajillas de peltre, trajes típicos, y también artículos de plástico, ya que está consciente de que le falta capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
José Elías is originally from El Sauce. He is 22 years old. He thanks FAPE and Kiva for the help provided as this is his second loan that he has requested. It has helped him a lot in his business, since he makes a living selling domestic goods, like ponchos, pewter dinner services, traditional outfits, and also plastic goods, to make payments in advance to be able to cancel and so request a new loan. 

He is requesting this loan to buy ponchos, pewter dinner services, traditional outfits, and also plastic goods, since he is aware that he lacks the capital to work.

loans.use: to buy ponchos, pewter dinner services, traditional outfits, and also plastic goods.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 35 years old, married and has a three-year-old daughter. She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a sari-sari or convenience store. Ailyn works hard to help her husband meet the needs of their family. She is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including canned goods, detergents and washing materials, soda, dry and snack foods and other items. With this loan, she will be able to attract more customers to her store. In the future, Ailyn hopes to make her business a bigger success so that it will generate enough revenue to meet the needs of the family, especially the future cost of schooling her daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 38-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He has two children ages 18 and 6 years old. Benjamin is able to support his family through his fishing ventures. He has been in the business for around 10 years and it is his primary source of income.
Benjamin has been a member of CEVI for several years now. The reason why he joined CEVI is because he wants to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. He is asking for a new loan worth 12000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to improve his daily catch and allow him to sell more fish to the market.
In the future, Benjamin dreams of making his business a success. Though this, he will be able to earn more money to meet his family's needs and expenses and for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn, 39, is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Rosalyn has run a general store for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalyn joined GDMPC. Rosalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: Genelita is 34 years old and lives in Pobalcion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She is in the business of selling seafood and dried fish, and earns approximately PHP 2,200 each month.  She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional seafood and dried fish to sell.  Genelita has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tauch

texts.en:
Tauch is 68 years old and the father of four children, living in Kompong Cham province. He operates a rice farming business to earn income for his family. He, at his age, is still strong enough to handle this type of business. He patiently works hard to provide the family with suitable living conditions. He dreams of having the financial stability that he will achieve someday.

He is now borrowing a loan of 400,000 KHR to invest in his business. He will buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops, and also pay for the operating expenses. He hopes this loan will be approved and he will be able to further develop his farming business towards the attainment of his goal.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops, and also pay for the operating expenses.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda, ella  es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque tiene 29 años de edad, es maestra de educación primaria y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de leña, y también elabora tejidos típicos, ya ha solicitado tres crédito y ha sido muy puntual nuevamente solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de leña, y también para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos.
texts.en: Irma Yolanda comes from San Martin Jilotepeque. She is 29 years old and she is primary school teacher. She also runs a retailing activity selling firewood on top of creating typical knitted items. She has already requested three loans and she has always been very punctual with her repayments. She is now requesting a new loan to buy firewood as well as to buy basic materials to create her knitted items.

loans.use: To buy firewood and knitted items.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Lydia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from fishing and pig fattening.

Lydia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Sacsayhuaman Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayde ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende pollo al horno,sopas,carne con arroz entre otros platos, la socia también prepara desayunos como leche, café y ponches, la socia tiene un puesto de venta de comida, la socia se dedica a este negocio 15 años, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, verduras y carne al por mayor para que cocine la comida.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de muñecas, negocio de venta de vinos, negocio de imprenta y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank “SACSAYHUAMAN”. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco.

Hayde is a member. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She works in her business selling food such as roast chicken, soups, meat with rice and other dishes. She also prepares breakfast like milk, coffee and punch. The member has a food stall, and has dedicated herself to this business for 15 years. In her free time, she likes to to take walks with her children. Her dream is to have a restaurant. The member is requesting this loan to buy wholesale products for cooking such as chicken, vegetables and meat.

The member who is added on to the group picture excused himself because of work and had his photo taken after.

The other members are in the business of selling handicrafts, the business of selling dolls, the wine sales business, the printing business and the food sales business.

Hayde is grateful to those that are part of this dream by means of this mode and is committed to paying her dues on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products for cooking such as chicken, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Nancy, miembro del Grupo Prosperidad y éxito

Nancy es uno de sus miembros, es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad; 2 de ellos ya son profesionales. Ella es consultora de belleza hace 7 años y fue su hermana quien la ánimo a trabajar vendiendo estos productos, gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo para poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos. Nancy es profesora de inicial pero dejo de ejercer su carrera por dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos,  su profesión le sirve para su trabajo; porque es muy comunicativa y sabe llegar a las personas por tener facilidad de palabra su clientela en su mayoría son sus familiares, amigos y personas que contacta en la calle, lo que más vende son cosméticos, perfumes y bijouteria. El préstamo solicitado le servirá para aumentar su negocio con la compra de productos de belleza, su mayor sueño en la vida es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

¡Nancy les agradece su apoyo!

*Nancy aparece en la foto con blusa color marrón con naranja.

*
texts.en:
Nancy is presented, a member of the Prosperidad y Éxito group.

Nancy is one of the members. She is married and has three adult children, two of them are already professionals. She has been a beauty consultant for seven years and it was her sister who encouraged her to work work selling these products. Thanks to her work she can help her husband to pay for the children’s studies.

Nancy was initially a teacher but left her career in order to take care of her children. Her profession suits her work purposes because she is very communicative and she gets to know people as she has a way with words.  Her customers are mostly relatives, friends and people on the street. What she sells most of are cosmetics, perfumes and costume jewelry. The loan she is asking for will be used to expand her business with the purchase of beauty products. Her biggest dream in life is for the children to become professionals and her business to continue growing.

Nancy thanks you for your support!

Nancy appears in the photo in the brown and orange blouse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes and costume jewelry in order to expand her business

loans.name: Dúo San Francisco La Jiralda Group

texts.es: Dúo San Francisco la Giralda,  este grupo está integrado por la señora Reyna ella es originaria de Tecpán Guatemala, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad  y se dedica  a la venta de ropa típica y como actividad secundario también se dedica a la crianza de animales, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa típica ya que está consciente de que le falta más capital para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
San Francisco la Giralda Duo.

Reyna is a member of this group.  She’s from Tecpán, Guatemala and has four minor children.   She sells traditional clothing and as a secondary activity also raises animals.   She’s requesting this loan to buy traditional clothing because she’s aware that she needs more capital to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. and her husband is a fisherman who earns about $5 a day. Three of her children are employed. They are garment workers and a construction worker. They earn about $9 a day. 

Phea is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for her son to run his taxi service. This purchase would enable her son to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run his taxi service.

loans.name: Yosselyn  Rosario

texts.es:
Les presento a Yosselyn, una joven estudiante de Enfermería en la universidad.
Yosselyn  ha pedido el préstamo para pagar un ciclo en la universidad. Ella está muy feliz por su préstamo por que de esa manera puede continuar estudiando, aparte de  sus estudios Yosselyn  trabaja como supervisora en una textileria este trabajo la ayuda para solventar sus pasajes y comprar algunos materiales que necesita para sus prácticas.
Yosselyn cuenta que siempre le gusto brindar servicio a las personas y tiene mucha paciencia por eso escogió esta carrera por que le gustaría atender a personas que están privadas de salud, para eso le gustaría trabajar en algún centro de salud, clínica o algún hospital. Su mayor sueño en la vida es lograr su objetivo ser útil a la sociedad y sobretodo ayudar a sus padres  que siempre la han apoyado,
Yosselyn  tiene un mensaje para los inversionistas Kiva: “Muchas gracias por ayudar a los que necesitan una oportunidad  y ¡qué bueno que existan personas como ustedes!”
texts.en:
Yosselyn is a young nursing student in the university.  She’s requested a loan to pay for a term in the university.  She’s very happy about the loan because she will be able to continue studying.  Yosselyn works as a supervisor in a textile factory; this work helps her pay transportation costs and to buy some of the supplies she needs for her school work.

Yosselyn relates that she’s always enjoyed helping people and she is very patient which is why she chose this career; she likes to take care of people who are unwell.  She’d like to work at a health facility or hospital.  Her greatest dream in life is to reach her objective and to be useful in society and above all to help her parents who have always supported her.

Yosselyn has a message for Kiva lenders: Thank you very much for helping those who need an opportunity.  How wonderful that people like you exist!

loans.use: to pay monthly university tuition.

loans.name: David Humberto

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! 

Les  presento a David, un joven de 26 años. David estudia Ingeniería de transporte  en la universidad. El  ha elegido esta carrera porque es nueva y muy interesante, son 5 años de estudios que ya culmino; actualmente esta ejerciendo su profesión ha empezado a trabajar en la gerencia de transporte urbano en la Municipalidad de Lima, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para tramitar su diplomado y empezar a estudiar una segunda carrera, su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir desarrollándose profesionalmente y ayudar a sus padres que siempre lo han apoyado. David se siente agradecido por saber que personas de todo el mundo lo van a  apoyar en sus estudios.

*David aparece en la foto con su sobrinito.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú.

This is David, 26, who is a young man studying transportation engineering at the university.  He’s chosen this career because it’s new and very interesting.  He’s completed five years of study and is currently working in his field and has started work in management for the city of Lima’s urban transportation system.  

The loan he’s requesting is to pay for the paperwork involved in formalizing his degree so that he can start to study a second career.  His greatest dream in life is to continue developing professionally and to help his parents who have always supported him.  David is grateful to know that people all over the world are going to support his studies.

*David appears in the photo with his little nephew.

loans.use: to pay to formalize his academic degree.

loans.name: Gladis Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Gladis hace 3 años es una socia más que conforma el banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le regala pintorescos paisajes, a su gente le orgullece aun mantener su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en distintas plazas de trabajo.
 
La Señora Gladis tiene 38 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el oficio que aprendió desde muy joven que es la de albañil, la casa en la que viven fue construida en unión conyugal.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y trabaja en las duras labores del campo como es la agricultura, sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar. También cría cuyes, pollos, vacas y cerdos a los que vende en su comunidad.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para todos sus animales y abono para mejorar sus cultivos y potreros.
 
Su meta es ampliar más el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Gladis has been a member of the “14 de Agosto” communal bank for three years.  She lives in Zhidmad Parish in Cuenca.  Its topography is quite fractured which gives it picturesque scenery.  Its residents are proud to retain their culture and traditions.  They work in agriculture, animal husbandry and many of them have various jobs in the city.

Gladis is 38-years-old, married and has three children who are 20, 18 and 15 years old.  Her oldest son works and helps her out economically and her younger two children attend a secondary school in the city.  Her husband works in construction, an occupation he learned while still very young.  They built their house together as a couple.

She does her housework and also works hard doing work in the field; her harvests are for home consumption.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, cows and pigs that she sells in her community. The money from the loan will be used to buy feed for all of her animals and manure to improve her crops and pasture ground.  Her goal is to expand the animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy manure and animal feed.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años, gracias a su trabajo y empeño logró comprar un terreno en el que construyó su casa y puede brindarle una buena estadía a su esposa Elsa, de 34 años, y a sus tres hijos.
La labor que realiza es labrar la tierra, cultiva cacao, café y hoja de coca. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, donde viene trabajando 15 años, en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta encontrar una movilidad que los lleve a su localidad donde los vende. Él se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo hoy disfruta de ver que sus plantas le dan buenas ganancias. Sin embargo, la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son los meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos, perjudicando sus sembríos, pero él sigue supervisando sus plantas para que estén saludables.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old. Thanks to his work and determination, he was able to buy a piece of land on which he built his house and can provide a good place to stay for his wife Elsa, 34, and his three children.

The work he does is farming. He grows cacao, coffee, and coca leaf. He is known for his hard work in the field, where he has been working for 15 years on his own lands. At harvest time he has the support of his children and day laborers who move the harvested produce until they find transportation that will take them to his town, where he sells it. He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his effort today he enjoys watching his plants give him a good income. Nevertheless, he does not like winter, because in those months a great quantity of insects abound that damage his crops. He keeps watching his plants so they will be healthy. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows that if he pays on time he will be able to access another loan with greater ease and without causing complications for his communal bank.

With these 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy manure for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase manure for his crops

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
Doña María conforma el banco comunal 14 de Agosto hace 10 años, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le regala pintorescos paisajes, a su gente le orgullece aun mantener su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en distintas plazas de trabajo. 

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, y su ultima hija estudia en una colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que se dedica a varios oficios, uno de ellos es la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa, trabaja cuando la llaman como jornalera, se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes, pollos y cerdos los que vende en su comunidad, también los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de helados.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas de alfalfa para mejorar sus potreros y también va a comprar cuyes, pollos y cerdos para continuar creciendo en este negocio.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the “14 de Agosto” communal bank for ten years.  She lives in Zhidmad Parish in Cuenca.  Its topography is quite fractured which gives it picturesque scenery.  Its people are proud to retain their culture and traditions.  They work in agriculture, animal husbandry and many of them have various jobs in the city.

María, 49, is married and has four children.  Three of them are already married and live on their own; her youngest daughter attends school in the city and her husband works in construction.  The house she lives in is her property.

María is a very enterprising person who has several occupations.  One of them is agriculture and what she grows is for home consumption.  She also works as a day laborer in the fields when she’s asked to and also works raising cattle, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs that she sells in her community.  In addition she sells frozen treats on weekends.

She will use her loan to buy alfalfa seeds to improve her pasture land and will also buy guinea pigs, chicks and pigs to continue growing in this business.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds, chicks, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Joab

texts.en: Joab is a 35-year-old, married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda.  He has been a teacher for eight years.  Joab used to teach in a government school.  He has since started his own school, since the facilities at the government school were not efficient for all of the pupils and the school was located on the outskirts of the village.  He is also a farmer.  He mainly grows rice and groundnuts, which he sells to traders from South Sudan.  One of his challenges is limited capital which prevents efficient delivery.   His dream is to have one of the role model schools in the district.  Joab is requesting  a loan to renovate his residential house.

loans.use: to renovate his residential house.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, from Pangabuan, Tangub City, is 56 years old, separated, and a mother of two. To make a living, for the past 15 years she has owned and operated a retail store where she sells school supplies, earning about PHP 5,000 a month.

In 2011, Concepcion joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to obtain more items to sell such as pencils, papers, glue, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as pencils, papers, glue, etc.

loans.name: Dalin

texts.en:
Dalin is 24 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Dalin is requesting a loan of $350, which she will use to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú- El entusiasmo y deseo de superación es lo que  caracteriza el grupo “María Elena Moyano”. Un grupo conformado por 6 integrantes, una de ellas es la Sra. Kharym de 26 años de edad soltera y madre de una linda hija de 6 años. Ella como todos los días se dedica a la venta de comida, que lleva a trabajadores en diversas fábricas, debido a una buena sazón y exigente preparación de los platos de comida ha obtenido una buena demanda por parte de sus clientes, en el futuro le gustaría poder poner un restaurant y así seguir con su negocio de venta de comida. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  utensilios de cocina. La Sra. Kharym se encuentra muy contenta con el préstamo otorgado al igual que el grupo María Elena Moyano están muy agradecidas por la confianza brindada y la ayuda que les están dando.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru.  We present to you a group of enterprising and dedicated women who are highly motivated to get ahead.  This is what characterizes the group “María Elena Moyano”.   

The group is composed of six members, one of whom is Kharym.  She is a single 26-year-old mother who has a beautiful six-year-old daughter.  Every day she works selling food, which she delivers to workers in various factories.  Due to her flavorful and skillfully-prepared dishes, she has come to be in high demand by her customers.  In the future she would like to be able open a restaurant and thus continue with her business of selling food.

She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of cooking utensils.  She is very happy to have this loan opportunity. Her group “María Elena Moyano” is also very thankful for the confidence it has brought them and the help that it is providing to them.

loans.use: to invest in cooking utensils.

loans.name: Mónica Susana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mónica es una socia activa que conforma el banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad que tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le regala pintorescos paisajes, a su gente le orgullece aun mantener su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en distintas plazas de trabajo. 

La Señorita. Mónica tiene 20 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño que tiene 11 meses de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es empleado privado y su mamá labora en los quehaceres del hogar, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

Ella por el momento se encuentra en tratamiento de una sinusitis que padece y espera mejorar su salud, su familia se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud por el momento.

La Señorita. Mónica esta laborando como cocinera en un restaurante de la ciudad, en casa cría animales a los que le ayuda a cuidar su mamá cuando ella se encuentra trabajando, sus animales los vende cuando ya se encuentran gorditos; también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y sale a vender sus productos dos días a la semana en un mercado de la localidad. Estas actividades le permiten aportar a la economía de su casa.
