Como todo transportista, sus dificultades son cuando su carro se descompone o no se realiza el mantenimiento (lavado y engrase). Para ello es que necesita el crédito, ya que gracias a ello podrá seguir con su trabajo, mejorando su carro.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, se siente contento por esta nueva oportunidad y agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. En su banco comunal es un socio activo y puntual con sus cuotas de pago.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará nuevos parabrisas, espejos y lo que requiera necesario el mecánico que arreglará su carro.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 24, is a young single man living in his parents’ house; he helps support them with his daily work.  He works providing transportation for passengers from community to community.  He has a car he bought with his parents’ help.  He started a year ago and what he likes best is chatting with his colleagues because they talk about ways to get ahead.  Like all transportation providers his difficulty arises when his car breaks down or it isn’t serviced (washing and lubrication).  For that, he needs the loan because thanks to it he’ll be able to stay in business and improve his car.

This is his 3rd MFP loan and he’s happy with this new opportunity and thanks those who make it possible.  He’s a very active, punctual installment paying member of his communal bank.  He will use these 1000 new soles to buy new windshields, mirrors and everything else needed by the mechanic to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy new windshields, mirrors and whatever else is necessary to repair his car.

loans.name: Butenga Parents Group

texts.en:
The Butenga Parents Group is located on the outskirts of Mpigi. The group is comprised mainly of women and one man whose major activity is agriculture. Their goal is to support each other out of poverty.

James is a divorced man with eight children; six of them are still in school. He also looks after his three nieces.

James is mainly an agriculturist who grows crops and rears pigs; he supplements the farming with firewood trading.

With the income from firewood trading and capital of 500,000 shillings, he resorted to agriculture in 1999 after separating from his wife so that he could fend for his children and take them to school.

He will use his loan to buy organic manure to improve his crop yields. His main customers are market vendors and passersby. The main challenges are price fluctuations and pests, which affect his cash flow.

His dream is to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Lwensinga Tusakimu Group

texts.en:
Goret is a widow aged 50 years. She has been in the group since 2006; she joined the male-dominated group so that they could help her learn how to work hard and be innovative, especially having been widowed at a relatively young age. She needed to work hard to be able to meet her family demands. 

Goret is a typical farmer. She grows beans, maize and millet. She has applied for shillings 300,000 which she will use to buy good quality seedlings of maize and beans for planting during the rainy season in September. She will use the profits after sales to pay school fees and buy her other household necessities. Goret is determined not to be left behind in this fast developing economy. Goret is standing at the front row on the left dressed in a pink attire.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en: Raymundo is from Lapasan, Clarin. He is 52 years old, separated and has two children. Raymundo owns and operates a transportation service. He has been engaged in his business for five years and earns 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Raymundo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle to improve his service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to improve his service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomatoes in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a grocery shop that has been operating for two years. 

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is seasonal weather.

Juma is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize, and charcoal to enlarge her business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to educate her other siblings. Her dream is to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and charcoal.

loans.name: Kamali

texts.en:
Kamali lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a greengrocery which she has been operating for two years. In this business, she sells tomatoes and greens.

Kamali learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock, and seasonal weather.

Kamali is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables at wholesale and tomatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to grow to a wholesale grocery and a supplier.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL NACIENTE” iniciará el ciclo decimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, elaboración de muebles, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, salón de belleza, micromarket, venta de alimentos balanceados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es una integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, ella nos cuenta que hace varios años decidió emprender este negocio por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, harina) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sol Naciente is starting its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer. Belonging to the regional hub of Collpani, it comprises seven members and is managed by a Board of Directors where Marisol is President. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, such as a neighborhood store, building furniture, selling blankets, selling vegeatbles, a beauty salon, a minimart, and selling animal feed.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs. Marisol is a member of this group and says she joined Pro Mujer five years ago through a friend and fellow member of the institution who invited her. She currently has a neighborhood store and tells us she decided to start her business several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase capital by purchasing rice, oil, and flour from distributing companies so that she can later sell them at her business location. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as far as possible, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the trainings regarding loans and health.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal nuestra esperanza esta conformado por 8 integrantes todas son mujeres comprendida en la edades de 35 a 50 anos con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Todas pertenecen a la localidad del Sauce municipio de León, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, queso, cuajada, crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras  que se conocen mutuamente y decidieron optar  a trabajar con los créditos de forma grupal, dentro de sus actividades económicas son: venta leche y cuajada, venta de gallinas, venta de cerdos, fritangas ellas realizan sus actividades en su casa de habitación por lo tanto tienen una rutina diaria de 12 horas por ejm:  Martha Lorena es la coordinadora de banco y tiene por actividad la venta de leche y cuajada por lo tanto su rutina levantarse a las 4:am para poder ofrecer su producto el cual es consumido diariamente en horas tempranas por los  vecinos de su comunidad. Todas   son mujeres muy humilde  del campo por lo tanto disfruta su trabajo a demás de ser su forma honrada de obtener ingresos para ellas es de mucha importancia el financiamiento que los prestatarios kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y de países pobre como es Nicaragua para seguir trabajando y vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Esperanza Communal Bank is composed of 8 members, all women, ranging in age from 35 to 50 years old. Together the women have 20 children under their care. All belong to the community of El Sauce in the town of León, an area known for its production of milk, cheese and curd and for raising chickens and pigs.

All of the women are very hardworking and were mutually acquainted with each other. They decided to apply for loans as a group in order  to support their various economic activities, which include selling milk and curd, selling chickens, selling pigs and selling fried snacks. They carry out their work in their homes and spend 12 hours a day in their daily routines. For example, Martha Lorena is the bank coordinator and sells milk and curd. She gets up at 4 a.m. to be able to sell her products, which are consumed daily very early in the morning by her neighbors in the community. 

All of the woman are very modest country people. Consequently they enjoy their work and consider it to be a respectable way to make a living. The funding that Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries, such as Nicaragua,  so they can continue working and living with dignity, is very important to them.

loans.use: to purchase and sell milk, cheese and curd.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 60-year-old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for several years now. Seaweed farming is a booming business in the country.

Esterlita is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming. With this, she will be able to improve production and yield, thus increasing her income.

Esterlita dreams of expanding and making her business a success so that it will continue to generate the necessary income to provide for family needs such as daily expenses and other costs. Moreover, she would like to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Aladin

texts.en: Aladin is from the Gardabani district. He is 65 years old and lives with his wife. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where broom plants are grown. Aladin produces brooms and sells locally. He is a very hard-working man, with a wealth of experience in his field. He has requested a loan to cultivate more land. He will sow broom plants and get a good harvest. This will enable him to produce more brooms and increase sales. He is hoping to generate profits from this loan and increase the income of the family as well as their living conditions. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is from Bacolod, Ozamis City, and has been in farming for 12 years, earning an amount of 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a loan of 22,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month, which she uses to pay for school fees and allowances for her children. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy eggplants, cabbages, tomatoes and string beans to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to make her business expand for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy eggplants, cabbages, tomatoes and string beans to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to diversify her farming business by venturing into poultry farming.

loans.name: Marvin Noe

texts.es:
El joven Marvin  de 29 años de edad, es casado tiene un hijo que depende de el, se dedica al comercio y reparación de bicicletas y motocicletas además de vender de llantas, rines, reparación y repuestos de bicicleta. Radica en una colonia de la cuidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Marvin esta solicitando el préstamo de 15,000.00 lempiras en esta ocasión para comprar llantas, rines y repuestos para bicicleta.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo Marvin desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que tiene para llevar a cabo  su proyecto y suplir la demanda que le hacen sus clientes.
Marvin su sueño es tener una buena casa para que su hijos esté bien y mejorar más su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Marvin is 29 years old, he's married and has a son who is dependent on him. He dedicates himself to providing repair services for bicycles and motorcycles and he also sells tires, wheels, and bike parts.

He lives in a colony of the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. This time, Marvin is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy tires, wheels, and bike parts. With the help of this loan, Marvin wants to replace the need for financing he has to carry out his project, and meet the demand of his customers. 

Marvin's dream is to have a good home so his children can be good and improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: to buy tires, wheels and bike parts for his business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 43 years old. He is married to Rachael, and together they have three children. He operates a quarry, and has been in the business for the past 10 years. This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the current loan to purchase another quarry. Samuel hopes to own a truck one day to aid him in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site.

loans.name: Bakhtiar

texts.en:
Bakhtiar is 38 years old and lives in the Gardabani district with his wife and two children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where greens are grown. Bakhtiar sells the greens at the local open market. In addition, he is involved in animal husbandry and has 3 milk cows and 5 calves. He produces dairy products and sells locally. He works very hard from early morning till late evening to do his best for his family. 

Bakhtiar has requested a loan to purchase more calves, which he plans to raise, fatten and sell at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. He will reinvest the profits in his agricultural activities. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase more calves

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Ruth is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soda, beer and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of UGX800,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, posho (a type of porridge) and drinks to sell, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and allow her to buy bed nets for her family. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another shop. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more rice, posho and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 20 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Cattaran. To add to the family's income, she sells fruits and vegetables. Mylene did not finish college, so she only vends merchandise. 

Mylene is asking for a loan of PHP6,000 to buy cabbages, bananas and tomatoes to sell.

In the future, Mylene would like to keep acquiring good profits so she can save funds to use in times of emergency, especially since her parents are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, bananas and tomatoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 41 years old, married, and lives in Clarin with her 9 children. She earns a living through firewood vending. She has been doing this for four years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from this work. Angelita has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP at GDMPC to buy more firewood to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is a 42-year-old married mother of 2 children in Bitoon, Ozamis City. For over 17 years she has made a living through the operation of a general store, where she sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009 Jasmin joined Kiva partner GDMPC, and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: John

texts.en: John has been a mixed farmer in Olkalau town for the past 12 years. He keeps livestock and also plants cash crops. He is 39 years old and is married to Tabitha, with whom he has three children. This will be John’s fifth loan from KADET LTD; he plans to buy animal feed, and also to buy materials for constructing a shed for his cattle. In the future, John hopes to expand his agricultural business, get more income and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and materials for making a cow shed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 60 years old and married to Eliud. They are blessed with three children, aged 27, 24 and 15 years old.

Jane has been in the farming business for 22 years in which she earns KES15,000. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.) and potato plants. The profit she gets she will plough back into the business. Her dreams are to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and potato plants

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Desde que era pequeño Joel siempre ha disfrutado de la vida en el campo. Nos contó que su padre le enseñó todos los secretos necesarios para poder lograr producir un café de excelente calidad. Con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la experiencia necesaria para poder independizarse y casarse con Lucia con quien tiene 5 hijos y toda la familia se dedica a realizar esta actividad. El café que ellos producen es convencional sin embargo ya han ido realizando las labores necesarias para convertir su producción a café orgánico. Este proceso lleva aproximadamente tres años ya que tienen que cambiar en su totalidad toda su plantación. Actualmente Joel necesita un crédito porque quiere comprar nuevas plantas las cuales le servirán para sustituir a las que ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida. Además de producir café José también produce maíz, frijol y chile pues de esta manera puede tener mejores ingresos para su familia. Pasando la siguiente cosecha de café José tiene planeado hacer algunas mejoras en su casa ya que está un poco deteriorada por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Since when he was a little boy Joel has always enjoyed life in the country. He tells us that his father taught him all of the secrets he needs to be able to produce excellent quality coffee. 

With time he has been gaining experience so that he can become independent and marry Lucia with whom he has 5 children. All of the family works in this area. At the moment they produce standard coffee but they are carrying out the work to convert their production to organic coffee. This process takes approximately three years since they need to completely change their plantation. 

At present, Joel needs a loan because he wants to buy new plants which he will use to substitute those which have complete their life cycle. 

In addition to producing coffee, Jose also produces corn, beans and chilli since in this way he can have a better income for his family. After the next coffee harvest Jose plans to make some improvements to his house which have become necessary due to accumulated wear and tear over time.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Dúo Flor De Fresa Group

texts.es: Dúo Flor de Fresa, Rafaela es originaria de la aldea Vista Bella Tecpán  tiene 3 hijos y ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, ella día a día se dedica a elaborar su producto ya que es la forma de darles lo necesario a sus hijos ya que su esposo murió hace unos años, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos para la venta.
texts.en: Part of Dúo Flor de Fresa, Rafaela is originally from the town of Vista Bella Tecpan.  She has three children and she works making traditional weavings by hand.  Day by day she works creating her products since this is the way that she can provide for her children's needs since her husband died a few years ago.  She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for the creation of traditional weavings to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the creation of traditional weavings to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres en Acción, María Juana es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque  y tiene 6 hijos ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano es una persona que lucha día a día  ya que su esposo no alcanza cubrir todos los gastos de la casa, entonces este es el medio con el cual ella ayuda a su familia,  está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres en Acción (Women in Action Duo), María Juana is a San Martin Jilotepeque native, and she has 6 children. 

She makes a living working on woven goods by hand. 

She is a person who works day by day since her husband cannot cover all of the costs of the household. This is the way in which she helps her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for the production of woven goods.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce woven goods.

loans.name: Dúo Luchadoras De Los Chajones Group

texts.es:
DUO CHAJONES 

doña Gloria Florencia Chajon quien es la líder y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para invertirlo en su pequeña tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diario que tiene en su casa desde hace 3 años y que necesita invertir porque su tienda es pequeña todavía y le faltan muchos productos además del sector en donde está ubicada su tienda es muy buena porque se vende muy bien pero no tiene el suficiente capital como para comprar mucho producto además beneficia a la comunidad para que no viajen a comprar todos los días porque quiere vender frutas y verduras que es lo que más piden.  Por eso solicita este crédito para invertir nuevamente en su tienda ya que nececita comprar mas productos comestibles  y así ampliar sus ganancias y seguir apoyando a su esposo.
texts.en:
DUO CHAJONES 

Gloria Florencia Chajon is the leader of the group and tells us that she is requesting this loan to invest in her little store of everyday foodstuffs that she has had in her house for three years.  She needs to invest because her store is still small and is lacking in many products.  In addition, the area that her store is located is very good because things sell well, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy enough stock.  Her store benefits the community because they don't have to travel every day to make purchases.  She wants to sell fruits and vegetables, which is what people ask for the most.  

Because of this, she is requesting this loan to invest again in her store since she needs to buy more foodstuffs and thus increase her earnings and continue helping her husband.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Catalina, vive con sus cuatro hijos todos mayores, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, de este negocio depende para poder obtener ingresos y velar por las necesidades del hogar tiene tres años de haber iniciado el negocio ya que su esposo murió y ella quedó al frente de su hogar, esta fue la alternativa más viable que realiza para poder mantener todo lo necesario a sus hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de aceite, tomates, carne, salsas, repollo, condimentos, que son las necesarias para que ella realice su venta todos los días, este préstamo dara a su negocio para aumentar la producción y también mejorará su vida cotidiana.

Su objetivo es mejorar su atención a los clientes para que su situación económica no se vea afectada, poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Catalina lives with her four children, all grown up, and is dedicated to selling pupusas. She depends on this business to earn a living and provide for the needs of the home. She started the business three years ago, when her husband died and she had to provide for the home. This was the most viable alternative to provide all necessary for her children.

She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of oil, tomatoes, meat, sauces, cabbage, seasonings, which are necessary for the sales every day. This loan will allow her business to increase the production and improve her daily life.

Her goal is to improve her customer service so her economic situation is not affected and she can give a better economic stability to her children.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes, meat, sauces, cabbage, and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer se encuentra, en su 19  ciclo, todas ellas trabajaron arduamente y en conjunto para poder llegar a donde estan llegando, muy agradecidas todas con la Fundación por la oportunidad brindada para que puedan ir saliendo adelante tanto individual como grupalmente.
la Sra.Luz, una de las integrantes del grupo tiene 50 años tiene 4 hijos tres grandes que ya le están ayudando con los gastos de la casa; ella compra  mercaderías de clorinda y las vende en su barrio. Tambien trae de Ciduad del Este, su fuente de ingreso es la compra_venta de mercaderías variadas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería varias como alimentos no perecederos como azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc. para luego revender a su clientela.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) committee is in its 19th loan cycle.  All of the members work arduously together in order to get where they are going.  They are very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity offered so that they can work to get ahead, both individually as well as collectively.  

Luz, one of the group members, is 50 years old and has four adult children that help her with household expenses.  She purchases her merchandise in Clorinda and sells it in her neighborhood.  She also brings in items from Ciudad del Este.  Her source of income is from the sales of a variety of products.  She is requesting this loan to purchase various goods such as non-perishable foods like sugar, noodles, rice, etc. that she can later resell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sugar, oil, eggs, rice, and noodles.

loans.name: Deng Ariath

texts.en:
Deng is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 4 and 17. All of them go to school.

Deng runs a manufacturing business, and he has been doing this for 10 years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through some other clients. He is taking out a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase metals and many other things. Outside of his business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Deng would like to expand his business and open other branches.

His major challenges include the high cost of transportation.

Deng says he is happy with the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy metals for making doors, beds, etc.

loans.name: Las Manzanas De Pamesebal Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, esta graduada en ciencia y letras, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a  la venta de cosméticos en diferente variedades, inicio este negocio con la necesidad de contar con su propio ingreso, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el poyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para mercadería, ya que quiere tener un negocio mas amplio. Espera en el futuro tener una tienda con local propio y vender a mayorista. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 34 years old and married.  She graduated with studies in the sciences and humanities and she has 4 children who are currently in school.  She works selling different varieties of cosmetics.  She started this business out of the necessity to have her own income and now she has five years of experience.  She counts on the support of her husband who also works in business.  She organized a group to request a loan which she will use to purchase products to sell, since she wants to expand her business.  She hopes to have a store in the future and sell wholesale.  The other group members work in business and raising domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
"Hard work, patience, and wise management are the characteristics needed in running a business," said Julie. She is 53 years of age, married, and has three grown-up children. Her children are all married.

She devotes most of her time to running her butcher shop. She has been doing this for more than 29 years. According to her, the profits gained from her butcher shop have been used to educate her three children. Julie would like to improve her business and offer her customers more products.

Julie's previous loan was used to increased the amount of frozen foods and meat she sells inside the market. So, as her business is growing, she is in need of more products. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000, which will be use to buy more frozen foods and meat, such as pork and chicken, for her butcher shop. She knows that she can obtain her goals in life and with her business, because she has already experienced some difficulties and has been able to adopt some strategies for overcoming them.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and meat, such as pork and chicken, for her butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to make embroidered Guatemalan dresses

loans.name: Lual Lual

texts.en:
Lual is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10, all attending school. Lual has operated a general store for 4 years and she has no employees. She has no other source of income. Lual's major challenge is high prices in the market.

Lual heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase kettles, flashlights, cups and many other items. In 5 years, Lual would like to expand her business. Lual says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as flashlights, cups, kettles, etc.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia, 55 years old, is married to Michael and they have nine children. Teresia has been a dairy farmer for the past 24 years. This is her second term loan with KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. Teresia was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase another dairy cow. Teresia hopes to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Khurshedjon

texts.ru: Хуршедчону 23 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 1 и 4 года. Его жена домохозяйка. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми средствами более 5 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как лук, капуста, свекла, репа, морковь и т.п. Ежегодно он арендует землю с площадью 2 га и упорно работает на этой земли. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его отец помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму  3000 долларов США, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khurshedjon is 23 years old, married and bringing up two children. His children are one and four years old. His wife is a homemaker. In order to provide for his family, for over five years Khurshedjon has been growing produce, such as onions, cabbage, red beet, turnips, carrots etc. Each year he leases two ha [about 5 acres] of farmland and works very hard. He sells his produce at a market. Since his produce is of high quality, there demand is high. His father helps him manage his business. In order to provide for his family, he wants to develop his business further, and thus he needs to increase the volume of produce. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD in order to buy mineral fertilizers. He will use the revenues from his business to improve the life conditions of his family. He needs your kind support and is looking forward to it.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 42 years of age, is married and has six children. She has operated her general store for one year and earns about PHP 5,000 a month.The profits gained from her business are used for the family's daily needs, the children's allowances and the maintenance of her raised pig.

Analiza's business goal is to increase the volume of her merchandise and to provide all the basic necessities needed in her village. She knows that when she runs her general store wisely, she will attain her great expectations: greater profits, customer satisfaction and, of course, expanding her store. Due to insufficient funds, she has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 in order to buy merchandise and to gradually improve her business plan for her general store. In addition, Analiza could send her children into higher levels of education and save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Atondobou Group

texts.fr: ATONDOBOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un certain Prosper. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont aucun n’est scolarisé. Christine et son mari vivent ensemble et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Christine a très peu fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Christine mène comme activité la vente de fruits saisonniers (ananas, etc.) du maïs et de l’oignon à son domicile. Christine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ATONDOBOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Atondobou is a group of three individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Christine (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 49 years old. Her husband’s name is Prosper. They have four children, none of whom is in school. Christine and her husband live together and jointly provide for various family needs. Christine has had very little formal schooling. For almost 25 years, Christine has been selling seasonal fruits (pineapples etc), corn and onions out of her home. She is dedicated to  this work which allows her to provide for herself and her children. Christine stocks up at one of Benin’s markets. In the search of meeting customer demand, Christine, along with the other members of the Atondobou group, is seeking a loan. This loan will allow the group members to better meet customer demand and increase their revenues.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, corn and onions.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita y sus hermanas se dedican a la producción del café desde hace muchos años. Ellas aprendieron desde muy chicas a trabajar en el campo por necesidad ya que su padre murió cuando ella tenía tan solo siete años y fue su madre quien les enseñó todo lo necesario para salir adelante. El café que ellas producen es orgánico y en la última cosecha alcanzaron un total de cuatro toneladas las cuales entregaron a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. Margarita y sus hermanas necesitan comprar planta de café para renovar parte de su finca pues algunas de las plantas que tienen sembradas ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productivo. Para hacer eso posible necesitan de un crédito. Si realizan esta acción dentro de tres años estarán produciendo un total de cinco toneladas lo cual les ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos. Además del café también se dedican a producir plátano y flores además de vender cazuelas y comales para hacer tortillas. En la fotografía podemos ver a Margarita en su tienda y con las ganancias que tenga en la próxima cosecha le gustaría poder surtirla con productos de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Margarita and her sisters have grown coffee for many years. They learned when they were very young to work in the fields out of necessity because their father died when she was only 7 years and it was their mother who taught them what was necessary to get ahead. The coffee that they produce is organic and in the most recent harvest they reached four tons of which they delivered to the Union Regional de Huatusco to be processed and exported.

Margarita and her sisters needs to buy coffee plants to renovate a part of their farm because some of the plants that they had planted already finished their productive cycles. In order to make this possible they need a loan. If they are able to finish this work within three years they will be producing a total of five tons. This will help them increase their earnings. 

In addition to coffee, they also grow plantains and flowers and sell different types of pans to make tortillas. In the photo we can see Margarita in her store. WIth her earnings that she will have with the next harvest she would like to stock the store with groceries.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants in order to renovate her farm.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Shaghat village, Syunik region, with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. The family is involved in agriculture: they raise sheep, cows, hens, cultivate wheat, barley, potato, grass and grow fruit trees. Armenuhi has applied for this loan to purchase a tractor. "It's very difficult without any agricultural technology. Collection of the grass and harvest requires some investments in connection with hiring workers and organizing transportation. The purchase of our own tractor will reduce our costs and allow us to have more income from agriculture", says Armenuhi. 
Armenuhi plans to purchase more lambs in the future. She wants to gather more milk and make cheese, the sales of which bring significant income from agriculture. The present reduction of costs will allow Armenuhi to have sufficient means to reach this goal.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a hardworking mother and a patient person. She is happily married and has been blessed with four children. One of her children is married and the other three are currently studying. Marita operates a rolling store (a store on wheels) around her village, offering a variety of vegetables, fruits, meat and charcoal. She is really thankful to our God Almighty because, despite the hardships and difficulties in life, still her family is able to manage it gradually. Marita's goal is to let her three children finish their studies and have a bright future someday. For now, she struggles with shortage of capital in her rolling store due to expenses for her 200 square meter fish pond.

Marita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy additional stocks of vegetables, fruits, meat, fish and charcoal. The loan will help her earn better profits which will enable her to attain her goals in life. Marita hopes that her rolling business has continuous improvement to provide a stable source of income, allowing her to educate her three children, to sustain their daily basic necessities and to have some savings for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables, fruits, meat, fish and charcoal

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera necesaria la compra de más mercadería para la venta de verdura fresca, por ejemplo tomates, cebolla, chiles y plátanos, que son algunos de los cuales ella necesita.

Ana esta motivada con su trabajo en la venta, ya que le permitirá mantener lo necesario en el hogar, con esta ayuda que se le brinda tiene mayor seguridad, hasta el momento ha mantenido un buen numero de clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan because she considers it necessary to purchase more merchandise for her fresh vegetable stall. For instance, tomatoes, onions, hot peppers and plantains are some of the items she needs.
Ana is motivated with her work on the stall, since it will allow her to support the needs of her household. With the help she's being given, she has more security. She has kept a good number of customers thus far.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, hot peppers and plantains.

loans.name: Francisca Alexia

texts.es:
Francisca, es madre soltera, tiene tres niños pequeños que dependen económicamente de ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, lociones y zapatos este negocio inicio con ayuda de una tía quien le dio asesoría para trabajar en el comercio, tiene dos empleados, trabaja todos los días desde hace un año.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa variada blusas, pantalones y también comprarse un lote de perfumería de diferentes fragancias, este crédito contribuirá a tener mejores condiciones en el negocio desarrollándose para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad, sus riesgos pueden ser los posibles robos delincuenciales.

Su aspiración es invertir en el negocios para maximizar sus ganancias, aumentando sus clientes potenciales y mejorando su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother. She has three small children that depend on her economically. She sells American clothing, lotions and shoes. She began this business with the help of an aunt who gave her advice to work in sales. She has two employees and has been working everyday for the past year.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing including blouses and pants, and to buy lotions of different fragrances. This credit will help her improve her business' conditions and developing it to offer her customers a greater variety of products. Her risks include possible delinquent robberies. 

Her goal is to invest in the business to maximize her earnings, increasing her number of potential clients and improving her personal and family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and lotions.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda's family earns a living by raising hogs and growing rice. She has been raising five pigs for more than two years. Bernalda is hardworking and business minded, even though she's old. At her age, she would like to have a stable source of income and improved living conditions without her children's help. Bernalda and her spouse would like to live independently from their four children, since all of them are married.

Bernalda wakes up early in the morning to feed her hogs and clean their pens to make them healthier and to avoid any disease that will affect their growth. While she is busy in her livestock business, her spouse is also busy taking care of the rice crops. The couple aims to have overall improvement to their livestock and farming businesses in order to fulfill their dreams in life. The prices of basic commodities, farming supplies and livestock feed are continually increasing so the capital intended for Bernalda's livestock business is no longer enough. Therefore, Bernalda is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sacks of hog feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper nutrition of her hogs. She believes that the amount requested will eventually make her dreams possible because she will be able to sell her hogs for a better price and obtain greater profits.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He aims to upgrade their living status to continuously send the children to school and give them a bright future. He engages himself in a hog-raising business to generate additional income.

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities Jorge has aimed to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of 35,000 PHP (Phillipine Peso) to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan and he is hoping that he will make the business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 57 years old, married and living in Tabid, Ozamis City. She has 8 children. She earns a living through providing sound system rentals. She has been doing this for 8 years and earns 4,000 a month from this work. Meriam has applied for a loan of 4,500 at GDMPC to buy more materials used in her business. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more materials used in her business

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is in his mid forties, married and has three children who are all attending school. Ismet’s family lives in central Albania near the national road that makes his business visible and accessible by almost all farmers who are in need for his services.
For the past ten years, Ismet has been operating a mill where he grinds corn and wheat and other grains as well. He inherited the mill, relevant skills and some of his current clientele from his father. Now Ismet plans on expanding the space of the mill to serve more clients and have more storage for the flour.
The loan he is now applying for is to properly cover the small mill building to prevent leaking during rainfall.
Ismet hopes that the lenders at Kiva will support him financially.

loans.use: To build the roof of his small-spaced mill

loans.name: Himatulo

texts.ru:
Химатуло родился 1959 году в Вахдате. Он живет с женой. Химатуло работает таксистом. В этой области у него имеется богатый опыт. В целях улучшения жизненных условий и в поисках доходов Химатуло в 1999 году занялся частным извозом на своем автомобиле. Сейчас он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. 
Химатуло берет кредит для ремонта автомашины и для проведения капитального ремонта в доме.
texts.en:
Himatulo was born in Vahdat in 1959.  He lives with his wife and works as a taxi driver.  He has a great deal of experience in this field.  With the goal of improving their living conditions and finding a good income, in 1999 Himatulo began using his own car for taxi services.  Now, he drives passengers on the route between Dushanbe and Vahdat.

Himatulo is taking out a loan for car repairs and for extensive home repairs.

loans.use: to repair his car and home

loans.name: Lourdes Vanesa

texts.es:
Lourdes, vive como  su familia, la integran tres hijos de 7,8 y 14 años de edad, su esposo tiene 34 años, ambos trabajan para el sostenimiento del hogar, ella trabaja en el mercado vendiendo ropa mixta osea ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, su horario es de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, su dificultad es la competencia, ya que está instalada en el mercado donde existen más puntos de venta, tiene más de tres años de estar en el negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse ropa para dama, ropa para hombres, ropa para niños, en blusas y faldas ropa interior, trajes, además invertirá una parte del préstamo en comprarse láminas para su casa, este préstamo le ayudará en el crecimiento de su negocio y poder tener mejores ingresos de la inversión que realice.
Los sueños de Lourdes, es que sus hijos estudien y salgan bien en su preparación profesional, ella quiere ayudar mejorando la vivienda, y trabajar por mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives with her family, including three children who are 7, 8 and 14 years old and her husband who is 34 years old. They both work to provide for the household. She works in the market selling varied clothing for men, women and children. Her schedule is from 6am until 3pm. Her main difficulty is the competition because the market where she is stationed has many other sales posts. She has had this business for more than three years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children including blouses, skirts, underwear and suits. She will also invest a part of the loan to buy metal sheeting for her house. This loan will help her grow her business and have greater earnings from the investment she has made. 

Her dreams are that her children study and are well prepared for their professions. She wants to improve her home and work to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear and suits.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 36 years old, married to Beatrice and they have two children. He has a quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru town and it has been profitable.

Having paid his previous loan amount well and in good time this will be his second loan. Joel plans to rent more land for quarrying and thereby be able to meet his customers' demands. He anticipates making more profit with which he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Joel hopes to invest in livestock farming, mainly, zero grazing.

loans.use: To rent more land for mining.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard lives in Mastara village with her husband, Yervand. Silvard and her husband are involved in agriculture. They raise cows, pigs and chickens and cultivate wheat. 

Current income Silvard earns from the sale of meat and milk does not allow her to purchase enough forage to feed the cattle during winter. This loan will help her to purchase grass for the cattle. With the loan's help Silvard will also purchase wheat seeds for autumn sowing. Silvard won't have to sell cattle to make these purchases. This is vital for her to keep earning stable income to make ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage

loans.name: Vitalice

texts.en:
Vitalice is 50 years old. He is married to Millicent and together they have five children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is a KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of rice, sugar, salt and flour for sale.


He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to own a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, sugar, salt and flour for sale.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es: Inocencio nos cuenta que él comenzó a producir café a la edad de 20 años ya que en ese entonces era la única forma de obtener ingresos en la comunidad en la que vive. Actualmente existen otras oportunidades de trabajo sin embargo él continua haciendo lo que mejor sabe y lo que más le gusta: producir café de excelente calidad. Al principio producía café convencional pero con el paso del tiempo fue cambiando toda esta a café orgánico pues es mejor pagada en el mercado tanto nacional como internacional. El entrega su café a la “Unión regional de Huatusco” para que sea procesado y exportado. Actualmente está produciendo alrededor de 8 toneladas por cosecha  y está solicitando un crédito para sembrar más planta y hacer labores de limpieza y de esta manera mantenerse en ese nivel. Inocencio tiene la satisfacción de ver que todos sus hijos ya han formado una familia así que como meta personal tiene componer algunos detalles de su casa para poder darle a su esposa todas las comodidades que se merece.
texts.en: Inocencio tells us that he started growing coffee at the age of 20, since back then it was the only way to get an income in the community where he lives. Currently there are other work opportunities, yet he keeps on doing what he does and likes best: producing excellent quality coffee. At first he grew conventional coffee, but in time he transitioned entirely into organic coffee, because it gets better prices in both the national and international markets. He takes his coffee to the Unión Regional de Huatusco for processing and exporting. He currently produces about 8 tons per harvest. He requests a loan in order to sow more plants and do cleaning work, and therefore maintain this level of production. Inocencio is pleased to see that all his children have already started their families, so his personal goal is to repair some small parts of his house so that he can provide his wife with all the comfort she deserves.

loans.use: to purchase and sow coffee plants.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, vive solo, tiene hijos pero no están viviendo con él, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, cuenta con bastante experiencia ya que aprendió desde muy joven.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto pequeño, esta inversión la realiza con la intensión de mejorar su ganadería y aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es mantener su trabajo, logrando mantener un buen numero de ganado para producir leche y comercializar .
texts.en:
José lives alone, although he has children they do not live with him. He makes a living in raising livestock and agriculture. He has a lot of experience since he learned when he was very young.

He is requesting a loan to buy livestock for small pastures. He will make this investment with the intention of improving his livestock business and increasing production. 

His goal is to maintain his work, and to reach a good number of livestock to produce milk and sell.

loans.use: to buy pasture livestock.

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa, aged 52, lives with her family, in a ger, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, whose name is Myagmardelger, is 48, and is a veterinarian. Her 21 year old son is a Buddhist monk and her 15 year old daughter goes to secondary school. 

Densmaa had started selling food in 2005, but at this time her living conditions were bad so she sold her livestock. Then she began to sell clothes at a local market. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolain Tughrik) loan.

With 1,600,000 MNT she will buy a notebook for her daughter and the rest of the loan will be used to buy inventory for her business. She also mentions that the new academic year is beginning and people will buy more clothes. Densmaa is a hardworking and tenacious woman.

loans.use: To buy a notebook for her daughter and to buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with four children who are aged between 14 years and four years old.

Samuel has a business of selling bread and has been doing it for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy more stock of bread to supply to his customers.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bread to supply his customers.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Meghri town, Syunik region. Tamara runs a little shop, where she trades in food and household goods. Tamara started this business in 2007. Now she needs some funds to enlarge inventory variety in her shop. This will allow Tamara to increase sales and get more income. 
Tamara lives with her 16-year-old son, Yeghishe. Tamara dreams to provide access to high education for her son. The current income she gets is barely enough to coveer daily costs. Development of the business with the loan's help is important for her to make this dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for food and household goods for her store

loans.name: Jonie

texts.en:
Jonie is a father who strives to improve their poor living condition to give his family a better life. He is 29 years old and has two infant children. Aside from farming, he also engages in buying and selling of motorcycle spare parts and lubricants in their village to generate additional income. He has been operating his business for almost two years and usually earns a profits of PHP 9,000 a month that he spends on their daily consumption and saves some for their future. 

He aimed to acquire more of the said products to sell but due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P30,000.00 to buy additional stock of lubricants, gasoline and spare parts for sale. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve the business and hopes that he will be successful in working out his plan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of lubricants, gasoline and spare parts for sale

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a fish vending business since her husband is a fisherman. They have been in this business for more than 20 years now.
Maria is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. With them, her husband will be able to increase his catch thus giving them more chance of increasing their sales and profit. 
In the future, Maria hopes of expanding their business and trying on other ventures. Moreover, she wants to continue to send her children to school for better learning and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Jay Mohaveer Self Help Group

texts.en:
Bini is a 50-year-old lady who has three children. The lady sitting in the middle, wearing a blue saree, is Bini. She lives in the Tangi village of Odisha, India, with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started a business making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

Bini is requesting a loan of 216,000 Indian rupees (INR) to buy more supplies such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is in a group of 12 members, all women who live in the same community. They named their group "Jay Mohaveer Self Help Group" (named after Lord Mohaveer, who they believe will protect them). They are situated in the Khurda district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing wheat, maize, grains, lentils, etc., for making flour.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, 37, is married and has eight children. For the past five years she has farmed rice to earn a living. Each month she earns about 3,000 PHP doing so.

In 2011 Elvie joined GDMPC. She is applying for a 4,500 PHP loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her paddy. Her aspiration is to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her paddy.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado en el comercio y en los oficios domésticos del hogar. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres ha sido una mujer muy luchadora. Hoy en día sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan para sostener su hogar. Junto con su esposo compraron un vehiculo para prestar sus servicios realizando viajes a distintas partes. También, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para reparar la carrocería de su vehiculo que esta en mal estado. Le es muy necesario hacer la reparación, ya que demandan muchos sus servicios y ella quiere ofrecer un buen servicio sin miedo que pueda ocurrir un accidente. Ella manifiesta, que el negocio es bastante rentable y con esos ingresos planea  ahorrar para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda construyéndole una habitación más, para vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53 year old married woman with four children.  Ever since she was young she has worked as a domestic house attendant.  Thanks to her parents' support she has been a very strong woman.  Her children work and help maintain the family home.  Her and her husband purchased a vehicle to use as a car service for people traveling long distances.  She also has a business of selling clothes. 

The loan she is seeking will repair the bodywork of her damaged vehicle.  It is very necessary to make this fix as the demand for her car service is strong and she wants to offer good and safe service.  She believes that this business is very profitable and will use her income to improve her home by building a new room thus living more comfortably.

loans.use: to repair the bodywork of her damaged vehicle.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy, 22, lives in Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years Prossy has worked hard in her maize fields to make a living.

Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops and so help her to generate greater profits. With these she will pay school fees and cover her family’s basic needs. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy pigs to raise and sell.

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize crops.

loans.name: Ann Jay Hanuman Group

texts.en:
Kumudin is a 40-year-old married woman who has four children. She is a native of the city Puri, but she lives in the village Balugaon of Odisha, India. Kumudin is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with work in her business. She has a business of growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market of the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well. 

At this time, Kumudin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. 

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group "Ann Jay Hanuman Self Help Group" (named after Lord Hanuman). The members of the group have selected Kumudin as their president. The lady standing in the middle, wearing a black and white striped pattern saree, is Kumudin. The common goal of this group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and tools for farming.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, 37, is married and the mother of four daughters who are all in school. They live in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province in Cambodia.

To support their children, her husband and she raise hogs. Her husband also works as a welder and washes cars. They have been working for nine years in these various occupations.

Ry has taken out eight loans with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, all of which she completely paid back and have progressively improved her pig business. Ry is now applying for another loan with VisionFund, this time for 1,000 USD. With this loan she plans to buy more piglets and an air pump for her husband’s business.

Ry hopes this loan will enable her to fatten up her pigs so that she can sell them for a good profit. She wants to make the family’s life better and especially to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and an air pump.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 39, married, and has two school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their community, while her husband cultivates their farmland. She aims to become successful in life so that she and her husband can educate their children and give them a better life. 

Jeanette aspires to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings to better satisfy her customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP, so she can buy those supplies, including rice, dressed chicken, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, beverages and seasonings. She hopes that through this loan she will work out her plan and move one step closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, dressed chicken, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, beverages and seasonings.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, para continuar vendiendo en las zonas donde tiene clientes, él se comprara ventiladores, gaveteros, planchas, esta compra le ayudara para mantenerse con varios artículos, para que sus clientes le compren porque son muy necesarios en el hogar.

Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior mejoro sus ganancias, ya que sus ventas se mantuvieron estables, tenia la mercadería necesaria y asi ha estado trabajando constantemente.
texts.en:
Francisco is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise so he can continue selling in the areas where he has customers. He will buy fans, cabinets, and irons. This purchase will help him to be able to support himself with various items so that his customers will buy them, as they are necessary household articles. 

He says that with the previous loan, he improved his income, since his sales remained stable. He had the necessary merchandise, and so he has been working consistently.

loans.use: to purchase fans, cabinets, and irons.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
Marta, está dispuesta a continuar comercializando semilla de  marañón, es por ello  que   ha tomado a bien  optar por otro crédito, para comprar más medidas de semillas de marañón crudas y poder así mantenerse en el mercado.

Ella expresa que el crédito anterior  le fue muy útil  en su negocio, ya que le permitido crecer en su negocio y en cuanto a las circunstancias familiares les ha cambiado mucho la calidad de vida  de sus hijos  pudiendo salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marta is willing to continue selling cashew nuts. That's why she has made the decision to opt for another loan in order to purchase more raw cashew nuts and therefore keep herself in business.
She reports that the previous loan was very useful, since it allowed her to grow in her business. In terms of her family's situation, it improved her children's living conditions a great deal, and they could get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts.

loans.name: Jimbo

texts.en:
Jimbo is 39 years old and has three school-aged children. He has been a farmer for almost ten years, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. Due to the high cost of school fees and daily needs Jimbo also raises hogs to sell.

Jimbo would like to deal in more pigs, but he hasn’t enough money. Therefore, he is applying for a 50,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets. He feels this loan will help him to successfully improve his business.

Jimbo is a responsible father who aims to improve his family’s standard of living and educate his children. He wants them to earn degrees so that they will become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and more piglets.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Sverdlov village in the Lori region of Armenia. She works in agriculture. Together with her husband Rita raises cattle. Currently their farm has 25 cattle and 11 cows. Rita sells the milk and cheese she makes in local markets. This is her main source of income, and is barely enough to cover household costs. Rita needs to be able to purchase grass to ensure her cattle are fed through the winter. This will allow Rita to keep earning a stable income from cattle breeding, and thus to sustain her family. Rita lives with her husband and their two sons and one daughter.

loans.use: to buy grass to feed the cattle over winter.

loans.name: Iluminación (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por tres personas, dos señoras y un señor, el grupo se identifica con el nombre Iluminación. Los miembros viven en un barrio del estado de Chiapas.

Don Mauricio es campesino y se dedica a la comercialización de ganado en donde lleva trabajando un año y dos meses. A su responsabilidad tiene a un hijo que está estudiando y quien durante los fines de semana lo ayuda a trabajar. Él invertirá el préstamo solicitado en la compra de ganados como vacas y becerros para posteriormente venderlos fuera y dentro de su localidad. Mauricio inició esta actividad para apoyarse con los ingresos de su hogar y darle lo más necesario a su familia. Comenta que desde muy joven él trabajaba en el campo y sus papá le enseñó la actividad para que con el tiempo supiera defenderse. Mauricio agradece a su padre por el apoyo que le brindó ya que ahora le va muy bien en su actividad de compra y venta de ganado.

Mauricio desea seguir trabajando para poder comprar lo más necesario y también usar sus ganancias para pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 
 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Marleni quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes y la señora Agdali quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, two ladies and one gentleman.  They call their group, Iluminación, and the members live in a neighborhood located in the state of Chiapas.

Mauricio is a farmer who sells livestock and has been doing this for a year and two months.  He has a son who attends school during the week and helps [Mauricio] on the weekends.  He will use the money from this loan to buy livestock such as cattle and calves to resell, both within and outside his area.  Mauricio started this business to earn a living and provide his family with all their needs.  He says that he started working in the fields when he was very young and that his parents taught him so that he could eventually become self-sufficient.  Mauricio appreciates his father’s support because things are going well for his in his livestock business.

Mauricio wants to continue working so that he can buy what he needs and also use his earning to repay his loan on time.

The rest of the members are Marleni, who will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store; and Agdali who will use the money to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Dúo Sineyes Group

texts.es:
DÚO SINEYES 
Este dúo lo forma doña María es soltera desde hace 3 años ella vende cortes  y les hace costura de diferente estilo  y también los compra ya hechos, ella solicita este crédito porque gracias a Dios sus ventas han incrementado además entrega semanalmente en el mercado de San Juan de 6 a 7 cortes y entonces necesita apurarse a hacerlos y para ello necesita materia prima ya que le paga la hechura de costura a otra muchacha cuando ella no alcanza a hacerlos entonces necesita invertir un poco mas, por eso solicita el crédito  para su negocio,entonces su credito lo nececita para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos.
texts.en: This pair includes Maria, who has been single for three years, and who sells clothing and alters them in different styles.  She also buys them ready-made.  She is asking for this loan because, thanks to God, her sales have increased and she delivers 6-7 articles weekly to the San Juan market.  She needs to produce them quickly, so she needs supplies.  She also pays another young woman to help her when she does not have enough time to make the items herself, and for this she needs to invest a little bit more.  She is asking for this loan for her business and will use the money to buy weaving supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene 65 años y desde hace más de 50 años se dedica a la producción de café ya que es el principal producto de la zona en la que él vive. Sus comienzos fueron con su padre quien también se dedicaba a esta actividad y le enseñó todo lo necesario para que se pudiera independizar y vivir del café. Alberto está casado con Angeles y tienen 4 hijos que ya están casados pero lo ayudan a trabajar en las fincas de café ya que para ellos es un negocio familiar y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Durante la época de cosecha ellos contratan personal para que los ayude en el corte pues es demasiado trabajo y no se dan abasto por si solos y de esta manera contribuyen a la economía de las familias de la gente que contratan. En la última cosecha Alberto y sus hijos tuvieron una producción de 8 toneladas las cuales entregaron en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que sean procesadas y exportadas. Para la siguiente cosecha Alberto solicita un crédito ya que necesita realizar labores de limpieza y siembra en sus fincas. Para dentro de un año él tiene planeado comprar una hectárea más de terreno para así poder aumentar su producción y su patrimonio. Otra de las cosas que a Alberto le gustaría comprar es un vehículo para transportar su café, anteriormente no lo había hecho porque la entrada para su terreno estaba en muy mal estado y era imposible que entraran las camionetas pero actualmente ya la han arreglado.
texts.en:
Alberto, 65, has been producing cafe for more than 50 years, since it's the primary product in the area where he lives. He started with his father who also grew coffee and who taught him everything he needed to know to be independent and live off of coffee. 

Alberto is married to Angeles and they have 4 children who are married but still help him in the coffee fields since it is a family business and their main source of income. During harvest time they contract laborers to help them with the cutting because there's too much work for them to do alone, and this way they contribute financially to the families of the people they hire. In the last harvest, Alberto and his children produced 8 tons of coffee, all of which they turned over to the "Union Regional de Huatusco" to be processed and exported. 

For the next harvest, Alberto asks for a loan because he needs to clean and plant his fields. Within a year he plans to buy another hectare of land so that he can increase his production and his estate. Another thing that Alberto would like to buy is a vehicle to transport his coffee. Previously he hasn't done it because the entrance to his land is in very bad shape and it was impossible for the trucks to get in, but now it has been fixed.

loans.use: to clean his fields and plant coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laguna Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo se integra  siete personas y cada una se dedica  a su respectiva actividad y viven  en un pueblo  llamado Coapilla que es un lugar fresco y tiene una laguna muy bonita.

Manuela de Jesús está casada con el señor Dionisio y tienen tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad, ella tiene doce años de casada y es muy feliz ya que su hogar es muy unido.

Esta es la 11° vez que Manuela de Jesús pide un crédito a VisionFund y lo invierte en la compra de frutas y verduras, actividad que le ayuda a incrementar los ingresos familiares. Ella tiene un lugarcito en el patio de su casa en donde exhibe las frutas y sus clientes le compran. Lleva realizando esta actividad tres años ocho meses está muy contenta con su trabajo.

anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración de pan y a la venta de pollos, actividades que también son productivas para ella. Sin embargo, con el préstamo decidió poner su negocio de frutas y verduras con el que se está apoyando para sus ingresos de su hogar. Lo que más desea es poder seguir aumentando cada día un poco más su compra para que sus clientes encuentren las verduras que desean adquirir.

Las personas que integran en el grupo son: 

Amelia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de marranos; la señora María Rosario, en la compra de abarrotes; la señora Yureni, en pollería; María del Carmen, en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de longaniza; la señora Dominga de Jesús, en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan y la señora María Erendida, en la compra de pan.
texts.en:
