This group is made up of seven people, each of whom has her own business.  They all live in a town called Coapilla, a lush green area that has a beautiful lake.

Manuela de Jesús is married to Dionisio and they have three children who depend on her.  She has been married for twelve years and is very happy because her home is very together.

This is the 11th time that Manuela de Jesús has requested a loan through VisionFund, and she will use the money to buy fruits and vegetables, which will help her to increase her family income.  She has a little area set up on her patio, where she displays the fruit and sells to her customers.  She has been doing this for three years and eight months and she is very happy about her work.

Previously she used to bake bread and sell chickens, which were also productive activities for her.  However she decided to use this loan to start her fruits and vegetables business to bring an income into her home.  What she really wants is to continue to increase her purchases a little each day, so that her customers can find the items they want to buy.

The other members of the group are:

Amelia, who will use the money to buy pigs; María Rosario who will buy groceries; Yureni will buy poultry; María del Carmen will buy ingredients to make sausage; Dominga de Jesús will buy ingredients to bake bread; and María Erendida will buy bread.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seafood and a fishing line.

loans.name: Concepción Marina

texts.es:
La señora Concepción tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo; pero no vive con ella. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a trabajar prestando sus servicios como empleada domestica. Esto lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, es una forma en que ella puede ganarse la vida. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar los postes, alambre, grapas, para pago de mano obra y reparar el cerco perimetral de su casa. Con la inversión ella tendrá más segura su casa y no estará preocupada que animales o personas extrañas ingresen a su propiedad.
texts.en:
Concepción, 50, is single and has one son who doesn't live with her. For 30 years she has worked as a domestic employee. She learned the trade through her own initiative because it was a way for her to earn a living.

The loan requested is to buy posts, wire, clamps and to pay labor costs to repair the fence around her house. This will make her home more secure and she won't be worried about animals or strange people entering her property.

loans.use: to buy posts, wire, clamps, and to pay laborers to repair the fence around her house.

loans.name: Bateswar Shg Group

texts.en: In 2009, nine women from Balipatna village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named "Bateswar Self Help Group". The members of Bateswar Self Help Group are all women from a district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Laxmipriya, who was selected as their president. The lady standing in the middle, wearing an orange saree, is Laxmipriya. Laxmipriya is 50 years old and is living with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer who has been farming for a long time. She got the idea of growing vegetables from her husband. She gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started with growing only a few vegetables like potatos, tomatoes and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumber, lady finger and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a larger scale. For this, she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing land, seeds and fertilizers for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (yurt) in Arhangai Province in Mongolia. He has worked for many years. In 2009 he started trading in animal parts such as skin, hooves and horns at the local market. His business's profit margin is 20 percent, and his cash turnover is 800,000 to 1,000,000 MNT a day.

Battulga is planning to expand into dealing in recycled glass, cans and plastic. He is a hardworking and humble person who is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan from XacBank to buy glass, cans and plastic at wholesale prices. His business's profits go to supporting his family’s needs and making his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy glass, cans and plastic at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Las Señoras De Mariscal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SEÑORAS DE MARISCAL” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de adobes, venta de comida, venta de lana de alpaca, venta de lana, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de jugo de piña, tienda de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitar su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de lana, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por recomendación de una amiga que también trabaja en el rubro. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que comprará de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community group called “LAS SEÑORAS DE MARISCAL” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela office.  The group is made up of nine members and run by a board of directors, where Juana serves as president.  The community group’s members run various types of business, including sales of: bricks, food, alpaca wool, wool, electronics, and candy.
 
This loan will help small businesses, such as Juana’s.  She says that it’s been a year since she joined Pro Mujer, after having been invited by a promoter who visited her home.  She currently has a wool selling business and tells us that she learned this business on the recommendation of a friend who also works in this field.

She will use the money from this loan to increase her working capital and buy wool in quantity from the saleswomen and resell it from a fixed location.  This type of work allows her to earn an income so that she can support her family.  She is in a live-in relationship and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, ha decido solicitar otro préstamo,  para comprar repuestos para reparaciones y mejorar el local, compra de marcos para colocar CD Y DVD como un muestrario, comprar cemento, pintura  para mejorar el local y comprar controles de equipo de sonido.

El  nos manifiesta que el préstamo anterior tuvo resultados positivos ya que le permitió mantener un rubro de ventas de CD y DVD, amplio su negocio y compro herramientas para el negocio. La cual  le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia el negocio ha mejorado  y le ha permitido construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carlos has decided to apply for another loan, in order to buy parts for repairs, to upgrade his shop and to purchase display frames for CDs and DVDs. He will also buy cement and paint for upgrading the shop and buy remote controls for sound equipment.

He says that the previous loan had positive results, as it allowed him to maintain a line of business selling CDs and DVDs. He expanded his shop and bought tools for the business. This has allowed him to raise his family. The business has improved and has allowed him to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy display frames for placing CDs and DVDs, and to buy cement and paint.

loans.name: Pedro Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento PEDRO LORENZO
está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Maryluz, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Pedro Lorenzo de ahí el nombre del grupo,  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maryluz va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Mariluz va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Mariluz  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Pedro Lorenzo" communal bank is made up of nine members, all women. The chairperson is Maryluz. She sells food at her stand, located in the community of Pedro Lorenzo, the place from which the group gets its name.  

This is her second loan with the institution, and  Maryluz is going to use it to buy tables and chairs for her business, to this way offer greater comfort to her customers. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Mariluz is going to use the profits to continue buying supplies, and keep improving her income this way. Her wish for her business is to have a restaurant, and this way offer better service to her clientele. 

Mariluz is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity offered to her and to her fellow group members, as in many cases they are people who are raising their families on their own.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is now 62 years old and has two grown-up children. They live harmoniously in the village planting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. Despite being a widow, she aims to improve their status of living and give her children a better life. With the help of her children, she can manage their rice farming business. She also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She planned to raise more pigs for sale but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 39,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Regina is married and has two children. To make a living, Regina is running a coffee and snack shop, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as "suman", "puto", bread and many other items. Regina has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. Regina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 1997, Regina joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old, lives in Nakuru and is married with one child who is in school. Her child is 14 years old.

Esther has a dairy business that she has been doing for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the previous loan. Esther intends to buy another dairy cow with the money.

She hopes to be able to meet the needs of her family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 33-year-old married woman with three children who are 16, 14 and 8 years old. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in fish vending and mobile prepaid load credit vending businesses in her community.  Rosela has requested a loan to buy more fish and mobile prepaid load to sell. 

In the future, Rosela wants to improve her business and make it a success. She plans to invest in another venture to augment her income. Moreover, Rosela wants to continually send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and mobile prepaid loads to sell

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en: Mariano is a farmer who is raising his family in a village. They plant corn and vegetables and raise livestock to sell. Despite the hardship of life, he aims to continue sending his children to school so that they will become professionals someday. Due to the high cost of tuition fees and commodities, he needs to increase his income to support their education and satisfy their needs. For this reason, he aimed to raise more pigs to sell but he has not enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for PHP 28,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He is hoping that he will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, se dedica a la agricultura y está solicitando un préstamo para preparar la milpa de postrera, trabajar  el terreno y para compra insecticidas, de herbicidas,  para quitar la maleza, compra de abono para nutrirla y luego sacar esa cosecha a la venta y dejar para el consumo de la familia.

Manifiesta que el crédito anterior le fue de gran utilidad porque le permitió sacar la mejor cosecha, aplicándole el mejor abono y así tambien tener mayor solvencia económica para satisfacer las necesidades del su familia.
texts.en: Paulino works in agriculture and he is applying for a loan to prepare the last field and work the land. He wants to buy insecticides, herbicides to get rid of the weeds, and fertilizer to increase the nutrients in the field. Then he wants to take this crop to market and leave some for his family to have. He says that the previous loan was very helpful because it allowed him to gather his largest harvest, use the best fertilizer, and that way have greater economic solvency to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides to work the land.

loans.name: Angel Lom Group

texts.en:
Ngaikim (the one with her right hand raised) is the wife of Mr. Khuplam who works as a security guard in a private company in Assam. She is a mother and is 50 years old. They have five children (two boys and three girls). Ngaikim is a member of Angel Lom. She sells charcoal and firewood in the local market. On average, she sells 10 bags of charcoal and 10- 50 bundles of firewood.
 
Ngaikim and her husband are illiterate. The family depends mostly on her charcoal and firewood business and sometimes her husband's meager salary sent from Assam. They want to provide their children with a good education despite their weaknesses and they work hard to give them a better future.  Now, the two oldest children are attending graduation courses, while their three siblings are still in high school. Because of this, she is compelled to borrow money often from near and dear ones and repay them whenever she can. 

Ngaikim is unable to increase her investment and raise the capital required to expand her business. With the KIVA loan, she wants to stock more firewood and charcoal to augment her income and contribute towards her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has a spare parts shop in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past 22 years. She is 46 years old and married to Peter. They have two children.

This is her second loan and she plans to buy spare parts. With the anticipated income, she plans to expand her business by buying more spare parts to sell.

In the future, she plans to invest more in her business by adding more types of spare parts and make more income, hence improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en: Hranush lives in Stepanavan town with her husband, Aleksander, and 4-year-old son, Tigran.  Hranush's husband works at a local factory and helps Hranush run the farm, where the couple breeds hens, pigs and turkeys and keeps one colony of bees. The main part of the family's income comes from sales of agricultural products. Hranush has applied for this loan to purchase wheat to feed the livestock. This is important for her to keep the farm operational. Hranush plans to purchase more pigs and beehives, which will help her to earn more income and improve the family's living conditions

loans.use: to purchase wheat to feed the livestock

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 43 years old from Nyahururu and is married with two children who are both in school.

Abraham has a retail shop, which he has been running for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy soap, eggs and cooking oil to add to his stock to sell.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To buy soap, eggs and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean is a mother of six kids, all of whom are attending school. She resides in a rural village of Ek Phnom district (Battambang). For the sake of her family's sustenance and her children's education, she and her husband have been working on their rice paddy, farming for 38 years.

 During the spare time, she also works as a fish-cutting worker for pay, whereas her husband raises cows as an extra income source. 

Her main challenge is the fruitless crop caused by the drought. Hean has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles and has paid back with success. She wisely has used her past loans to cater for her children and better her business and her household. 

For this loan cycle, she and another two clients -- one of whom is a sixth-time borrower, and the remaining one an eight-time borrower -- are borrowing as a group. As the group leader, Hean will use her loan portion to pay for harvesting. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner so as to sustain the good progress of her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting.

loans.name: Agdam

texts.en:
Agdam is 32 years old, married and has one daughter. He has run a business selling food products for the last eight years. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni.
 
His business brings him a stable income of 170 AZN. He would like to increase his income and for this purpose he applied for 1800 AZN. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his fifth loan and he has a good loan repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more products for his food business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.
Wilma has a store that sells fresh milk. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more fresh milk to resell.
Wilma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh milk to resell.

loans.name: Zarqalam

texts.en:
Zarqalam is 57 years old, married and has five children. She sells watermelons and melons, as well as such seasonal fruits as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU Zarqalam was able to start her own business. She has 10 years of experience and the reason to start the business was poor living conditions and a low pension.  

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. She sells crops from her house where people regularly stop by to buy some fresh fruit. Her monthly income from this business is 180 AZN. Zarqalam's husband helps sell the fruit.

Zarqalam wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover high demand. She would like to purchase more fruit and vegetables and increase turnover as well as to improve living conditions for her family. For this purpose, she applied for a 1500 AZN loan. This will be her second loan and Zarqalam has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Zedbazar is a herder. Her oldest daughter, Handmaa, is a transaction agent in a private business. Her oldest son, Demberelsambuu, is unemployed and her younger daughter, Nyamjaw, is a college student. She started her business in 2009 by selling food and flour on a rental counter in the black market. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. She is planning to improve her business by adding a shoe-repair feature. She is an honest and hardworking person. She is requesting 2 000 000 MNT to buy raw materials for her new business and make an educational payment for her younger daughter.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her new business and make an educational payment for her younger daughter.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is 45 years old, divorced and has two daughters. His primarily activity for the last 10 years has been selling food products. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni. He is responsible for supporting his parents and children. His sister helps him sell products. 

His shop is located in a central bazaar which is why his products sell very fast. His business brings him a stable income of 200 AZN. He would like to increase his income and for this purpose he applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products to his shop.

loans.use: to buy and diversify food products.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 46-year-old widow with one adult daughter. She lives in the town of Agsu. To make a living, Gulshan raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruit for sale. Gulshan has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 250 AZN a month from these activities.
Gulshan joined AqroInvest to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of 1000 AZN, which will also be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Gulshan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is 46 years old and married with four children. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat to local butchers right from his home. Nizami has more than 10 years of experience in this field thanks to his father who taught him best how to raise cattle.

Nizami usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them in five to six months and resells them for profit at the local livestock bazaar.  Meat-selling brings him a 200 AZN income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. 

This is only one income source for his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Nizami applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase four head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy four head of cattle.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is 36-years-old, married, and has two children. He runs a blacksmith shop where he makes wrought-iron gates, railings, and chairs. He has been in this business for the past 14 years and earns a monthly income of 200 AZN, which he uses to support his family members.

Yashar wants to expand his business in order to serve more customers. He wants to buy new machinery that would make him capable of diversifying his output; therefore, he is asking to borrow 1000 AZN. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and live a stable life with his family.

loans.use: to buy new machinery.

loans.name: Mijiddorj

texts.en: Mr. Mijiddorj is 32-years-old and lives with his wife and four children in a small old house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife, Sosorbaram, is 37-years-old. She helps him with his organic vegetable growing and trade business. His wife also teaches organic vegetable growing techniques to local residents. His three older children go to the secondary school and his youngest son goes to kindergarten. He started the family organic vegetable growing and trade business in 2008, so he has experience in this industry. His local customers appreciate him as a hardworking and honest person. He is requesting 2,100,000 MNT loan to build an underground storage pit to extend the life of his products.

loans.use: To build an underground storage pit to extend the life of his agricultural products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38-years-old and married to Ampai. They are blessed with two children aged 16 and six years old. She has been in farming business for one year and has an income of KES 4,500. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more farm inputs. 

She will use the profit she gets to expand her farm; her dream is to have a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 43 years old; she is married to James and they are blessed with one child who is 15 years old. She has been in business for 12 years in which she earns KES 15,000. This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She will use it to purchase more clothes for sale. With the profit she makes, she will expand her business and educate her children. Her dream is to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a sari-sari (convenience) store for more than two years now. She sells snack foods, household materials and other items to the people in the community. As of this time, Mercedes needs more funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 4,000 to buy additional stocks to sell in her store such as: canned goods, biscuits, detergents, soda, snack foods, and others. Through this, Mercedes will be able to attract and cater to more customers and will increase her sales and profit from the business. Mercedes hopes of making her business a successful one in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her store such as canned goods, biscuits, detergents, soda, snack foods, and others.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, aged 38, is a villager from Battambang province's Sangke district. She is the mother of two children; one of whom is a student and the other is a paid worker. To fight for the family's hardship, she has been growing rice for ages, and her husband has been working at a construction site in Thailand. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about KHR 24,000 and save about 5,000 KHR per day after deducting expenses. Sary is in the sixth cycle while her member is in the fourth cycle with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She has used her past loan wisely in managing her business well. She has paid back the entire loan. She is now leading a group of two female members. She is seeking KHR 400,000 whereas her member is applying for KHR 100,000. She will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay plowing fees. She hopes to stabilize her living condition and expand her business order to enlarge her income so as she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en: Edisa is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. They live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Edisa and her husband are engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income to provide for the needs of the family and expenses. Edisa works hard to support her husband in meeting their needs. However, she needs funds for their business to grow. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 10,000 to buy fishing nets, fuel, and to the repair the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more chance of increasing their sales and profit. In the future, Edisa dreams of uplifting their livelihood. Moreover, she wants to send her children to school and hopes of seeing them as successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fuel, and to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon has received great progress from the loan he received. He purchased new automobile accessories from the first loan. He also managed to repay his loan in full on time. He is now asking for a loan of 52,250 Kenyan shillings to purchase more spare parts and car accessories. He believes that his business has a great future and this will help him provide for the needs of his children.

loans.use: To purchase automobile parts and car accessories.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin is married and has three sons. Their family is very positive and their relationship is based on love and respect. Shahin has his own business. He is a well-known blacksmith in the neighborhood of Agsu and has a good reputation. He needs to buy electronic devices that are required for his business; he is requesting a loan in the amount of AZN 1,500. His income will go towards improving the living conditions of his family. Shahin is a very ambitious man who is trusting and responsible; with your help he will succeed.

loans.use: to buy electronic devices.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her four children, in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband passed way. Her older son's name is Bat-erdene; he is 20 years old, and works for a local private company. Her oldest daughter is a college student, and her two younger children go to secondary school. Previously, she worked at a local private construction company as a chef. She graduated from a sewing course in June, 2012. Now she would like to start her own sewing business. Therefore, she needs fabric and string, so she is requesting 3,500,000 MNT. In addition, she has taken a seamstress course, and she is planning to add this service to her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and string.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret repaid her previous loan well and is grateful for the progress her business has witnessed. 

She is applying for a second loan of 41,850 KES to increase the stock of cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora María de 48 años de edad, es casada no tiene hijos que dependen de ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotaría y frescos en su negocio de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de Amapala, al sur de Honduras. Ella se dedica desde hace 11 años a esta actividad Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Doña María esta solicitando el préstamo de 22,000.00 lempiras para comprar mercadería como frescos, leche, maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, carnes, embutidos, cafe, pan, huevos y otros productos de consumo básico.
Doña María con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea surtir un poco mas su negocio y vender mas y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a salir adelante en su hogar.
El deseo de Doña María es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
María is 48 years of age, married, and has no dependent children. She works selling grocery items and fresh foods in her grocery store, which is located in her house in a community in Amapala, in the south of Honduras. She has worked in this business for 11 years, and is a hard-working woman with a huge desire to get ahead in life.

María has requested a loan of 22,000.00 Honduran Lempiras to buy merchandise such as fresh food, milk, corn, beans, rice, sugar, meat, cold cuts, coffee, bread, eggs and other basic items. With the support of this loan, she would like to buy more supplies to sell in her business and, in this way, have more income that will help her household to get ahead. María’s dream is to make improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: To buy fresh food, milk, corn, beans, rice, sugar, meat, cold cuts, coffee, bread, eggs and other items for her business.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Es albañil desde que tenia 18 años de edad, el oficio lo aprendió con unos amigos. Por la razón, que cuando se caso vio la necesidad de aprender de todo. Además, de la albañilería, él junto a su esposa se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa desde hace dos años. 

Ellos se levantan muy temprano a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos; para que se vayan a la escuela; ellos se quedan en casa arreglando las maletas para salir a vender la ropa, regresan a la casa de 12:00 p.m. a 1:30 p.m. a preparar el almuerzo a sus hijos y por la tarde asisten a la iglesia. 

Los productos que necesitan para su negocio, los compran en una ciudad. Para llegar a ahí debe caminar a pie unos quince minutos, luego aborda un autobús que tarda unos treinta minutos en llegar a su destino.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de dos docenas de faldas, blusas, brasieres, blumeres, tangas, calcetines, calzoncillos, boxeres, pañuelos, etc. Con la inversión podrán suplir la necesidad de ofrecer mejores artículos ya que les demandan sus clientes cosas que ellos no andan por falta de dinero. Por otra parte ellos comprar cada ocho días y con el préstamo compraran para el mes, a fin de comprar a un mejor precio, más variedad. Todo lo que hacen es para proporcionarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, siendo su objetivo que sus hijos terminen la universidad. Pues él no lo pudo realizar por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years of age, married, and has four children. He has worked as a builder since he was 18, and he learned this trade with some friends. This was because, when he got married, he needed to learn everything. In addition to working as a builder, alongside his wife he also works selling clothes on the street, and has done so for two years.

Miguel and his wife get up very early to make breakfast for their children before they go to school. They stay at home organizing suitcases which they use to take the clothing out to sell, and come home between midday and 1:30 to prepare the lunch for their children. Then, during the evening, they go to church. They buy the products they need for their business in a city. To get there, they need to walk for about 15 minutes, and then take a bus for 30 minutes before arriving at their destination.

Miguel plans to use his loan to buy two dozen skirts, blouses, bras, women’s underwear, socks, men’s underwear and boxer shorts, handkerchiefs, etc. He plans to use this money to meet the need for better items, as his customers request things which they cannot supply due to a lack of money. They also go to buy items every eight days, and with the loan they will be able to buy for the whole month, so that they can buy at better prices and with more variety. Miguel and his wife do all they can to give their children a better quality of life, and their goal is to ensure that they finish university, but Miguel has not been able to do this yet due to a lack of resources.

loans.use: To buy two dozen skirts, blouses, bras, women’s underwear, socks, men’s underwear and boxer shorts, handkerchiefs, etc.

loans.name: Twige Group

texts.fr:
Henriette fait partie du groupe Twige et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle  a 37 ans et est mariée à Pontien, un commerçant de lait. Ils n’ont pas encore d’enfant.

Elle fait le commerce de lait depuis  4ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  un réfrigérateur pour  une bonne conservation de lait. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait avoir sa propre maison pour exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Henriette is part of the Twige group, and lives in Cibitoke. She is 37 years of age and married to Pontien, who works selling milk. They do not have any children yet.

Henriette has worked selling milk for four years, and this is her fourth loan with Turame. She plans to use the Kiva loan obtained to increase her capital and buy a new fridge, so that she can preserve her milk well. Over the coming years, she would like to have her own house so that she can carry out her business.

loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase a fridge, so that she can preserve her milk well.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Porfirio compró refrescos e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas rápidas como panes, carne verduras y salsas, disponiéndose especialmente para las festividades de cada fin de semana.  Su nuevo credikiva, al que ahora aplica será un fondo de efectivo para hacer nuevas compra de embutidos y carnes, con los que pretende aumentar su producción de salchipapas, perros calientes, chuzos hamburguesas, pues ahora su ubicación es en una plaza adjudicada a los vendedores que antes estaban ubicados en espacios públicos. Porfirio se encuentra muy feliz y agradecido con los financiadores de Kiva  y espera seguir recibiendo este apoyo económico para continuar progresando tanto en su empresa como en su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio used his prior Kiva loan to buy soft drinks and supplies to make his fast food, such as bread, meat, vegetables and sauces. He was particularly interested in obtaining supplies for the weekend festivities. The new Kiva loan he has applied for will be a cash fund to buy new supplies of meat and cold cuts, which he will use to increase his production of fried potato with sausage, hotdogs, skewered meats and hamburgers. This is because he is now located in a square which has been made available to vendors, who had previously been located in public spaces. 

Porfirio is very happy and thankful to Kiva lenders, and hopes to continue receiving this financial support so that he can move forward professionally and with his family.

loans.use: To buy cold cuts and meats, which he will use to increase his production of fried potato with sausage, hotdogs, skewered meats and hamburgers.

loans.name: Adriana Azucena

texts.es:
Adriana Azucena con 33 años de edad es comerciante desde hace 12 años,  con la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante, originaria del departamento de Masaya, inicio su negocio en su casa de habitación,  cuenta que busca la manera de emprender en lo que ella se propone, comenta que  anteriormente la familia de su esposo vendían cerdo frito con yuca, pero dejaron de vender, y su esposo le propuso seguir con el negocio así fue como comenzaron entre los dos, actualmente ella también puso una venta de perecederos (frutas y verduras), y aparte que ella también sale a vender productos de la avon,  la zermat y cosas de platas. Por las mañana vende ella y por las tarde sale a ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes que tiene y son fijos.
Se acerca a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo en el que pueda reabastecer su negocio en la compra de coca cola, golosinas y galletas, frutas y verduras, bisutería, juegos, 1 qq de azúcar, 1 qq de arroz, entre otros. y seguir trabajando en lo que ella mas le gusta,  y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana Azucena is 33 years old. She has been a merchant for 12 years. With her husband's help, they have gotten ahead. She is from the Masaya department and started her business in her house. She says she is seeking the way to be the kind of entrepreneur she wants to be. Her husband's family used to sell fried pork and yucca, but they stopped selling it. Then her husband proposed to her that the y continue with the business but between the two of them. Now she also sells perishable items (fruits and vegetables) and she also goes out to sell Avon and Zermat products and silver jewelry. She works at the store in the morning and goes out to offer her products to regular customers that she has in the afternoons.

She came to our Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan to re-stock her business. She will buy Coca-Cola, snacks, fruits and vegetables, jewelry, games, 100 kg of sugar, 100 kg. of rice, and more. She will keep on working at what she likes the most and be able to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy Coca-Cola, snacks and cookies, fruit and vegetables, jewelry, games, 100 kg of sugar, 100 kg of rice, and more.

loans.name: Leidy Esmeralda

texts.es:
Leidy tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Desde hace 8 años es dueña de una tienda, su mamá fue quien le enseño, ya que ella poseía una. Los productos los compra en una ciudad que esta a sesenta minutos de su casa y viaja cada tres días a realizar sus compras. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar aceite, bebidas, granos básicos, papel higiénico y medicinas. Así, ella tendrá mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y recibirá mejores ingresos que le permitan construir una casa para sus hijos y proporcionarles la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leidy is 30 years old. She is the single mother of two children. For 8 years she has been the owner of a store. Her mother was the person who taught her about the business, since she has a store as well. She buys her products in a city that is seventy minutes from her house and travels every three days to do the purchasing.

The loan she is asking for is to buy oil, basic grains, toilet paper and medicine. This way, she will have a larger quantity of products to offer her customers and will receive more income that will allow her to build a house for her children and offer them the opportunity to finishe their studies.

loans.use: to buy oil, beverages, basic grains, toilet paper and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Loeurn's Group

texts.en:
Loeurn is 22 years old and a father of one son. The rest of his family is living under a thatched roof house located in a rural village of Sangke district, Cambodia. He generates his family's income from growing paddy-rice and working at a construction site. He has been involved in this business for four years and is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day after the daily expenses of 27,000 KHR per day. 

Recently, he has been faced with the insufficiency of the water supply which has lowered his yields as the main challenge. Loeurn took his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) four cycles ago. He has completely paid back the loans which have helped him to maintain his business and earn a decent margin to relieve his family's financial burden. 

To keep supporting his business, he is in a group of two members as the leader. He and his co-member are fifth-cycle loan clients who are requesting 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. For Loeurn, his loan portion will be used to buy rice seed and to pay for a plowing fee. He expects to grow his cash crop fruitfully so that he can multiply his income and keep up a good lifestyle.

loans.use: To by rice seed and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
Age 23, Soth is a rice farmer who needs to support her one little son. Together with her family, she is residing in Moung Russey district's Kampong Cham province. Her one-hectare area of rice cropping earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. She has been in this business for five years, but she has not received high yields due to the lack of water supply. 

Soth, a first-time borrower client, is forming a group of three female members. The other two fellow group members are second time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. All of them are taking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Soth will use her portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy insecticide for her rice field. She expects to maximize her income from her current business so as to sustain better living conditions.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy insecticide for her rice field.

loans.name: Boanerges Arcides

texts.es:
Boanerges, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mariscos (pescado, camarones, langostas) para el restaurant, con el objeto de adquirirlos a mejor precio para mantener en el menú para los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a tener la disponibilidad económica para realizar la compra.
Manifiesta que con el aporte de estos préstamos, ha podido mantener lo necesario en el restaurant, manteniendo más variedad en los menús, las circunstancias familiares se ha mantenido, y en su negocio la rentabilidad sigue aumentando.
texts.en:
Boanerges has requested a new loan to buy seafood (fish, prawns and lobster) for his restaurant. He aims to buy them at a better price, so that he can keep the same menu for his customers, and this loan will help him to have the available finances to make these purchases.

Boanerges says that these loans have allowed him to keep what he needs in the restaurant, as well as giving his menus more variety. His family circumstances remain the same, and profitability keeps increasing at his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, and lobster.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en: Yunus has repaid the previous loan well, and having cleared the first loan, he is now asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail goods to sell. He believes this will help his business improve, especially now that the season is picking up.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like sacks of beans, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.en:
Rosalio is a 41-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has three children who are still in school. Rosalio is a fisherman and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. He works hard to support his family and for the schooling of his three children. 

At this time, he is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch and eventually his sales. In the future, Rosalio dreams of making his fishing venture a successful one.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Marío Antonio

texts.es:
Mario tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus  dos hijos. Desde hace dos años instalo una pequeña tienda, que con mucho esfuerzo la ha mejorado. Antes era de su mamá y fue ella quien le enseño a administrarla. Él viaja cuarenta kilómetros para llegar al lugar donde compra la mercadería para su tienda dos veces al mes, debido a que compra por mayor. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mercadería para la tienda como chinas y ropa deportiva; porque sus clientes le buscan esa mercadería y no la posee. Así, podrá fortalecer su negocio, a fin de vender más productos y recibir más ingresos para invertirlo en mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario is 32 years of age, and lives with his life partner and two children. Two years ago he started running a small shop, which he has improved through a lot of effort. It formerly belonged to his mother, and she was the person who taught him how to run it. Twice a month Mario travels 40 kilometers to arrive at the place where he buys stock for the store, as he buys wholesale.

Mario has requested this loan from Fundación Campo to buy more merchandise for his store, such as assorted items and sports clothing. This is because his customers ask for these products and he does not have them. He will therefore be able to strengthen his business, allowing him to sell more products and have more income, which he will invest in improving his home.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his store, such as assorted items and sports clothing.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
One head of a family originally from Muong Russey district, Tha is a 33-year-old mother of five school-aged kids who are studying in a local public school. She strives to make a living with her husband on five hectares of farmland by rice cropping. Additionally, she also raises pigs at home and her husband also works for others for a fee.  She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and it is a challenge to her due to the shortage of rainfall. 

Tha's group is composed of three members, all of whom are second-cycle loan clients. The previous loan, which she has repaid, has helped her to uplift her living standards and improved her business gradually. She and one of her fellow members are applying for 1,200,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is seeking 600,000 KHR. She is the group leader and she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide. She will also use a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to add to her income from her current business and attain a good lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 28-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 6. Aileen relies on seaweed farming to earn an income for her family. This business started 7 years ago and has been her main source of livelihood. She is asking for a loan to pay for gasoline, engine repair and plastic rope. These inputs will better prepare her for the new days of seaweed farming. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and make it bigger so she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: to pay for gasoline, engine repair and plastic rope.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Mean is a citizen living in a rural area located in Moung Russey district's Battambang Province, where rice cultivation is one of the core businesses for the villagers to generate more income, and it is for Mean. Besides working on the paddy field, she also grows corn on a three-hectare area to better support her family. Her main challenge is the shortage of water supply which reduces her yields. 

This is the first loan for Mean and her member, who are in the same group consisting of two female members. They are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Mean is the group leader, and will use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farm. She expects to plant her cash crop on time and earn a larger income to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farm.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia, Sokhom, 48, is married with five children, one of whom is dependent on her and works at a garment factory to help the family generate income. To meet the family’s needs, Sokhom has been engaged in farming rice on one hectare of farmland for twenty-three years, and she also supplements her income by selling fish in the local area. The current business earns her approximately US$5 per day to support the family. 

This is the third micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for Sokhom’s group. The past two loans have helped to support her farming business. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of KHR 700,000 each. Sokhom, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor for plowing. She hopes to grow her rice paddy timely and healthily and produce a large income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Kzh/ Mrndo Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco  fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere Kzh/Mrndo. Le nom du groupe signifie «se soutenir».Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 5ans  à 20 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculture de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le premier agriculteur du riz dans la vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Twitezimbere Kzh/Mrndo group, the name of which means “supporting each other”. He is 45 years of age, married, and has six children aged between 5 and 20, four of whom are at school. He himself studied six years of elementary school education.

Jean Bosco works as a rice grower, and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his business. To increase his rice-growing activities, he plans to request other loans to expand his rice business. Over the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to become the best rice grower in the valley. He plans to use his profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, vive sólo, tiene una casa elaborada de láminas, la cual consiguió donada por parte de la alcaldía, es jornalero y también siembra maíz, las siembra la realiza en un terreno que alquila, los trabajos de jornal lo realiza con algunas personas del lugar.

Está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse materiales que le permiten realizar el trabajo de la agricultura protegiendo la siembra de las plagas, se comprará semilla, abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo le permitirá tener el dinero necesario para poder iniciar su trabajo y aplicar estos materiales, su riesgo es que la cosecha tenga inconvenientes por el clima, ya que perdería la producción.

Su objetivo es trabajar por su propio beneficio, al futuro poder ir mejorando la vivienda y tener las entradas de dinero necesarias para cubrir sus necesidades
texts.en:
Fidel lives alone, and has a house made of metal sheets which was donated to him by the town hall. He is a day laborer and also grows corn on a plot of land which he rents. He carries out his daily work with other people in the same area.

Fidel has requested a loan to buy materials to carry out his agricultural work, protecting his crops from plague. He will buy seeds, manure and fertilizers, and the loan will allow him to have the money he needs to start work and use these materials. The risk he faces is that his crops may be jeopardized by the climate, in which case he may lose them. Fidel’s goal is to work for himself, and in the future he would like to improve his home and have enough income to provide for himself.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
Navbahor is an enterprenurial person who is married and has 3 children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 5 years. Little by little with the passing of the time she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large number of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Navbahor is looking for a loan to buy cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. Jose de 40 años de edad es viudo tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de el económicamente. El actualmente esta viviendo en unión libre, Jose recibe dos pensiones una por viudes y la otra por discapacidad ya que tiene un problema en la columna. Para el su familia es lo mas importante y sabe que tiene que mantenerlos seguros es por eso que en esta ocasión solicita de nuestra ayuda para construir una barda en su domicilio. Comenta que esta muy contento con nuestra institución y las facilidades de pago qe esta ofrece. Jose agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Jose is a 40 year old widowed father of 3. His children still depend on him financially. Right now he is in a common law marriage. Jose receives 2 pensions: one for being a widower and and another for disability because he has a problem in his spine. For him his family is the most important thing and he knows he has to keep them safe. That is why, at this time, he is asking for our help to biuld a fence around his house. He remarks that he is very happy with our institution and with the ease of payments it offers. Jose will be grateful for any help that can be given.

loans.use: to put up a fence around his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical cables, installation permits, electrical posts and to pay labour in order to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Gloria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella a trabajado toda su vida en la venta de tamales de elote y lo aprendió de su madre. Se desplaza cinco kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad, en donde compra el maíz, pues es donde lo compra a mejor precio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar un molino pequeño para procesar el maíz en su casa, debido a que le sale muy caro y lejos asistir al molino de otra persona todos los días. Además, comprara otras cosas para el hogar. Por lo que ella manifiesta que se ahorrara tiempo y dinero. También, podrá prestar los servicios a otras personas. Gloria desea trabajar muy fuerte para comprarles una casa a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She has worked her whole life selling corn tamales, which she learnt from her mother. She travels 5 kilometres to get to the city where she buys the corn, as this is where it is sold at the best price.

She is requesting this loan to buy a small mill in order to process the corn in her house. This is because it is very expensive and far away to travel to another person's mill every day. Apart from this, she will buy other things for her house. This is why she says that she will save time and money. Also, she will be able to offer her services to other people. Gloria wants to work hard in order to buy a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy a small mill in order to process corn in her house.

loans.name: Nelis Beatriz

texts.es: Nelly compró mecatos refrescos y mercancía en general, con la que surtió su negocio y esto fue gracias a su credikiva; ella estuvo muy satisfecha porque aumentó sus ventas y con ello su rotación de inventarios. En la actualidad está preparándose para acceder a un nuevo credikiva y con él comprará cervezas en mayor volumen para tener un Stock disponible, pues es un producto de mayor rentabilidad que rota semanalmente y en un volumen importante.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Gracias por todo quedé encantada con mi crédito”
texts.en: Nelly bought drinks and general stock with which she stocked her store thanks to her Kiva loan. She was very happy because she increased her sales and as a result her stock rotation. Presently she is preparing to receive a new Kiva loan and with this she will buy beer in greater volume in order to have stock readily available. It is a highly profitable product which rotates weekly and in high quantities. Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you for everything. I was very happy with my loan."

loans.use: to buy beer in greater quantity to stock her store.

loans.name: Abafatanyamugambi / Mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Barthelemy  fait partie du groupe Abafatanyamugambi /Mgnz. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui ont le même objectif».Il a 47 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 ans  à 17 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Barthelemy est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre se activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le grand producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Barthelemy is part of the Abafatanyamugambi /Mgnz group, the name of which mean “those who have the same objectives”. He is 47 years of age, married, and has six children aged between 3 and 17 years of age, four of whom are at school. Barthelemy himself studied six years of high school.

Barthelemy works as a rice grower, and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business. To increase his business, he plans to request other loans to expand his rice-related activities. Over the coming years, Barthelemy would like to become a large rice producer in his region. He hopes to use the profits to pay for his children’s education and medical fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence in the back of his house.

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del banco comunal  “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, solo uno está a su cargo.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal que a pesar del tiempo que lleva no tiene problemas porque cuidan mucho que su banquito no caiga en morosidad, se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro (14K), fantasía y pasamanería, su negocio está bien surtido.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 juegos de collares, 25 aritos de catorce quilates, 50 aretes para niñas, un ciento de ganchitos de niñas, un ciento de colets.
Está muy dedicada a su negocio, a pesar que su esposo trabaja siente la necesidad de tener algo propio donde pueda disponer y también poder ayudar a sus hijos en lo que necesiten, gracias a Manuela Ramos  por brindarle la oportunidad ser socia y muy cumplida por cierto.
texts.en: Delia is a member of the communal bank "Santa Barbara" from the district of Coronel Portillo, in department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, is married and has two sons, but only one is under her care.  She is one of the founders of this communal bank that, despite  the time, she has never had a past due loan. She makes a living selling gold jewelry (14K), gold imitations  and trimmings, and her business is well stocked. With her new loan of S/ 3.000 new soles she will buy: 50 sets of necklaces, 25 bracelets of 14K, 50 earrings for girls, a hundred clips for girls, and cents of hair bands. She is very dedicated to her business, despite the fact that her husband works. She feels the need to have something of her own so she can help her children in what they need. Thanks to Manuela Ramos that gave her the opportunity to become a member.

loans.use: to buy: 50 sets of necklaces, 25 bracelets of 14K, 50 earrings for girls, a hundred clips for girls, and cents of hair bands

loans.name: Maria Ancelma

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, casada, madre de 9 hijos , de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de tamales, elotes y güirilas lleva 20 años con esta actividad. Ella no fue a la escuela pero si fue alfabetizada aprendió a leer y a escribir. Es originaria de la Concordia municipio de Jinotega al norte de Estelí antes se dedica a vender en una pulpería pero después decidió emprender su propio negocio. Comenzó a vender elotes , tamales dulces y güirilas (tortillas hechas a base de maíz dulce) . Este negocio le ayuda a llevarles el alimento a sus hijos. 
Ella vende de manera ambulante sale todos los días desde temprana horas a recorrer las calles y comarcas cercanas para ofrecer sus productos hechos a base de maíz. 
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar elotes , leña y azúcar que son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para vender sus productos . Uno de sus planes futuros es poner un pequeño negocio de venta de elotes en el centro de la ciudad , por lo pronto esta trabajando fuerte para pagarle los estudios a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
María is 59 years of age, married, and mother to nine children. She works in retail, selling tamales, corn cobs and maize pancakes, and has done so for the past 20 years. She did not go to school, but she did learn how to read and write. 

María is originally from La Concordia in the Jinotega area, to the north of Estelí, and she used to run a grocery store. However, she decided to start up her own business, and began selling corn cobs, sweet tamales and “güirilas” (pancakes made using sweet maize). This business helps her to provide food for her children. María works on the street and leaves home early each day, working on the nearby streets where she sells her corn-based products.

María has requested this loan to buy corn cobs, firewood, and sugar, which are some of the raw materials she needs to make the products she sells. One of her plans for the future is to have a small corn cob sale business in the city center, and right now she is working hard to pay for her youngest son’s studies.

loans.use: To buy corn cobs, firewood and sugar.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre no tiene dependientes económicos. El es un joven trabajador y emprendedor ya que ha seguido adelante con sus estudios el trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes de la localidad en el turno de la tarde. Ha sabido salir adelante a pesar del estrés que provoca el hecho de estudiar y trabajar al mismo tiempo, esto nos demuestra las ganas que tiene de salir adelante y convertiste en un gran profesionista. En esta ocasión Carlos esta solicitando de nuestra ayuda para utilizar el dinero en gastos escolares como uniforme, inscripciones, mensualidades, etc.
texts.en: Carlos is a young man who is 21 years old, single and lives with his mother. He does not have any financial dependants. He is a hard working and entrepreneurial young man who has continued with his studies. He works in a local general store in the afternoon shift. He has been able to get ahead despite the stress of having to study and work at the same time. This shows that he is very eager to get ahead and become a great professional. On this occasion Carlos is requesting our help in order to use the money to pay education costs such as his uniform, registration, monthly payments, etc.

loans.use: to pay for education costs such as registration, uniforms, supplies, etc.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 33-year-old mother from Ndunyu Njeru in Kenya. She is married with two children who are aged 16 and 13.

Rahab has a general store that she has been running for the past 12 years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and salt to add to her sales stock. She hopes to expand her shop and open another shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Maura es socia del banco comunal “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito Coronal Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 82 años de edad, está casada y tiene 11 hijos.
Son catorce años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de joyas de fantasía y pasamanería, en un mercado de la zona.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: medio ciento de eretes, medio ciento de collares, medio ciento de anillos, un paquete de canchos, un paquetes de vinchas, un paquete de carmines.
Son artículos que más demanda tienen y que no deben faltar en su negocio para poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes que por años le vienen comprando.  A pesar de su edad sigue trabajando, es que lo hizo casi toda la vida, su esposo es jubilado y tiene que trabajar para no depender se sus hijos.
Agradecen a Manuela Ramos por permitirle seguir integrando este banco comunal
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Santa Bárbara communal bank, located in the Coronal Portillo district of the department of Ucayali. She is 82 years of age, married, and has 11 children.

Maura has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 14 years now, and she works selling costume jewelry and accessories in a local market. With her new loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles, she plans to buy 50 earrings, 50 necklaces, 50 rings, a pack of hooks, a pack of hair slides and a pack of lipsticks. These are the most sought-after items, and are must-haves for her business if she is going to continue serving her customers who have purchased from her for years. Despite her age, Maura keeps working as she has done so all her life. Her husband is retired, and she has to work so that she does not have to depend on her children. She thanks Manuela Ramos for allowing her to continue to be a part of this communal bank.

loans.use: To buy various items of jewelry and accessories.

loans.name: Lesly Suyapa

texts.es: Lesly tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja en un centro de salud. Lesly desde hace 4 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, también vende leche y productos lácteos, el negocio lo aprendió de su padre ya que el se dedica al mismo rubro, las dificultades que enfrenta es la delincuencia y la competencia que hay en la zona. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para la compra de seis vacas, con el apoyo de este préstamo la vida familiar cambiara ya que tendrá más fuente de ingreso. Los sueños que tiene Lesly es que su hija se realice profesionalmente, hacer crecer su ganado para que le genere mayores entradas y poder ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. Es su segundo crédito en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Lesly is 37 years old, married and has one child.  Her husband dedicates himself to farming and also works at a health facility.  For the past 4 years, Lesly has dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of livestock.  She also sells milk and dairy products.  She learned the business from her parents, as they also carry out the same line of work.  The difficulties she faces are the delinquency and competition that exist in the area.  She is requesting the loan she needs to buy six cows.  With the support from the loan, the family’s life will change, as she will have more sources of income.  The dreams Lesly has are for her daughter to become a professional so she can have more opportunities, and to be able to help support the family.  This is her second loan with FAMA and she has made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
La señora Blanca es socia del Banco comunal “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene  42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos en su poder.
Desde hace tres años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de joyas  de fantasía y también pasamanería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: un ciento de ganchos  de niñas,5 paquetes carmines, 4 paquetes de  piojitos, medio ciento aretes, medio ciento  anillos, medio ciento de  pulseras, aros.
Su negocio, que tiene varios años, está creciendo porque dedica todo su tiempo y la atención es personalizada, es lo que le gusta a sus clientas y siempre está trayendo las novedades  para las damas.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “Santa Bárbara” cooperative bank of the District Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children in her care.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for the past three years, and dedicates herself to selling costume jewelry and also braiding.

With her new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy:  one hundred girls’ clips, 5 packets of red beads, 4 packets of small beads, fifty earrings, fifty rings, fifty bracelets, hoops.

Her business, which she’s had for several years, is growing because she dedicates all her time to it and provides personalized attention.  This is what her customers like, and she is always bringing in new novelties for women.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue working in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy earrings and accessories.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto, a 56-year-old married father of a four-year-old son, lives with his family in Bien Unido, Bohol. Edilberto meets the needs of his family by fishing and farming seaweed, locally known as "guso". He works hard for his family so he can provide food and pay the household bills.

Now requesting a loan to buy gasoline, straw, wooden stakes and clothing, in the future Edilerto hopes to have a bigger seaweed farming enterprise that will support his family as well as allow him to save for old age.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, straw, wooden stakes and clothing.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
La señora Emelina es socia del banco comunal “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, casada cuatro hijos, solo tres viven con ella.
Ya tiene tiempo trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, con éstos préstamos empezó su pequeño negocio que poco a poco está creciendo, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 mesas, 25 banquitos, 1 cómoda, 2 camas de una plaza, 2 estantes pequeños, 2 mesitas de centro, 1 juego de muebles, todos son comprados en blanco ella les da el acabado a todos los muebles.
Ha tenido que contratar a una persona que hace los trabajos de laqueado, también está generando empleo y está contenta porque su negocio está mejorando una, a fin de años mejoran las cosas porque hay más demanda de los muebles
texts.en:
Ermelinda is a member of the “Santa Bárbara” cooperative bank of the District Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 54 years old, married, and has four children, but only three live with her.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for some time now.  With these loans, she started her small business that has grown little by little.  She dedicates herself to furniture sales.

With her new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy:  2 tables, 25 stools, 1 chest of drawers, 2 trundle beds, 2 small bookshelves, 2 coffee tables, 1 furniture set.  They will all be purchase in white, and she will do the finish on all the furniture.  She has had to hire a person who does the lacquer work, so she is also generating work and is happy because her business is helping someone.  At year-end things improve because there is more demand for furniture.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto, de 35 años de edad habitante de la comunidad llamada El Rodeo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor, él ya es un cliente recurrente, el utilizo su primer crédito para comprar 2 vaquillas , le fue bien pues logro sacar leche para vender , pero su demanda aumento y no tiene como abastecer  al resto de sus clientes. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para comprar 3 vaquillas para producción de leche para venta y consumo de su familia. El desea progresar su familia junto con su familia,  pagar el crédito  y continuar produciendo leche.
texts.en: Roberto, 35 years old, lives in a community called El Rodeo, located in Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Estelí.  His work is farming.  He is a recurring client, having used his first loan to buy 2 cows.  Things went well, as he was able to obtain milk to sell, however demand grew, and he could not supply the rest of his customers.  This is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy 3 cows for milk production to sell, as well as for consumption by his family.  He wants to progress along with his family, pay the loan, and continue to produce milk.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows.

loans.name: Karla Sadith

texts.es:
La señorita Karla es socia del banco comunal “Las Margaritas” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene compromiso.
Lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y los está invirtiendo adecuadamente, ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una vitrina para exhibir todos los productos que tiene en stock y puedan ser mejor apreciados por sus clientes, también comprará perfumes, cremas y talcos.
A su corta edad ya está dedicada al negocio y le gusta mucho porque trata bastante con diferentes personas y lo bueno de todo es que sabe administrar su negocio.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder obtener un crédito sin mas requisitos.
texts.en:
Karla is a member of the “Las Margaritas” cooperative bank of the Coronel Portillo District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 19 years old, single, and is not engaged.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for one year, which she is investing adequately.  She dedicates herself to selling catalog beauty products.

With her new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy:  one display case to exhibit all the products she has in stock so they can be better appreciated by her customers.  She will also buy perfumes, creams and powders.

At her young age, she is already dedicated to the business and enjoys it a great deal because she deals a lot with different people.  Best of all, she knows how to manage her business.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to obtain a loan without more requirements.

loans.use: to buy a display case, perfumes, creams.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is 49 years old and married. She lives with her husband and seven children -- four daughters and three sons, all of whom are dependent on her. Some are in school, while the others work as paid workers.
